Title: Data Analyst @Mercedes-Benz Financial Services
Description:
Mercedes-Benz Financial Services is the brand finance company of the Mercedes-Benz Group. Our goal? To offer mobility and financing solutions to all customers and lovers of our star.




We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Online Sales and Loyalty team. The objective is that through descriptive analytics and diagnosis, insights and recommendations can be generated that support better decision-making and help increase the conversion of the online channel.




For this reason you have to be able to work autonomously and that you like it. In addition, you have to be independent but in a highly collaborative environment. We are looking for a professional who is passionate and motivated by data and their work, ready to be challenged and challenged!




Responsibilities:




Perform a variety of analyses to discover audiences and behaviors in CRM, with the goal of finding and implementing new use cases.
Create audiences so that they can be used for A/B testing, CRM activations and even Paid Media.
Be able to define KPIs for the evaluation of marketing activations and verify that these measurements are technically possible
Evaluate the success of personalized actions and define the next steps due to learning.
Identification of Insights with clear commercial recommendations.
Be able to perform query Google Cloud.
Work as a team with the IT & BI areas to collaborate in the evaluation of data quality and build new data, tools, etc.




Qualification:




Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Economics or another degree with a strong analytical content
Total mastery of Excel, SAS and SQL (knowledge of other programming languages such as R or Python will be an asset)
English level B1.2 or above, with at least 3 years of experience in a comparable position, transforming data to extract key business insights using statistical/analytical concepts




Skills:




Independent, motivated, proactive and ready to take responsibilities to the next level
Be able to work in a team
Be an organized but adaptable and flexible person in the face of a dynamic and changing environment
Be eager to learn and understand the goals and needs of the business
Excellent communication skills, being able to translate the execution of technical data into insights and business recommendations
Customer-centric and problem-solving with communication skills that favor multidisciplinary work

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Junior Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising together!




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +11 countries & +260 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market




YOUR CHALLENGE

You will propose new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasp the attention of the public and transmit complex information into simple explanations
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc.)
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales, to marketing, to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze performance of our current Contextual products and actively proposing improvements together with the Product Team
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics related field
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutions
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment
You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!




It would be a big plus if you

Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders




SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, NY..., üèñÔ∏è)

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Christmas events.

üèã Gympass




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.




Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At EA, we thrive on outrageous thinking. It‚Äôs the fuel that inspires the best games in the world. We‚Äôre innovators and great storytellers. But it‚Äôs not just about amazing your peers, it‚Äôs about amazing yourself. Take risks. Collaborate with great minds and dare to dream big. Do you want to come with us? Together, we are changing the way millions play every day.

EA inspires the world to play, and the Worldwide Localization Team makes that happen! We are accountable for delivering the high-quality localized versions of our titles to over 30 countries around the world. You will find a vibrant, multicultural environment with a great mixture of professionals. From software engineers, project managers, testers to audio, text and linguistic specialists, each employee has an important role to play. EA has built a cutting-edge Localization powerhouse that covers the needs for both current and next-generation platform

Are you a dedicated and experienced Data Analyst looking for an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team? We are seeking a talented individual to become a key player in our Loc Data & AI team at Electronic Arts (EA). This role is pivotal to our data-driven decision-making process, where you will analyze data to uncover insights that enhance our gaming.

Responsibilities


Data Analysis: Analyze complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
Visualization: Create compelling data visualizations and reports that effectively communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Usability: Design and develop user-friendly dashboards, reports, and tools to facilitate data-driven decision-making.
Storytelling: Craft compelling narratives to convey complex data insights and recommendations to various audiences.
Ownership: Deliver end-to-end data projects, from initial data requirements gathering and validation to final analysis and presentation.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate data insights into business strategies.
Data Quality: Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with organizational standards.
Tool Development: Develop and maintain tools, scripts, and documentation to support data analysis and visualization.


Qualifications And Skills


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field with relevant experience or a Master‚Äôs degree.
A minimum of 5 years of experience in providing valuable insights that have demonstrably enhanced outcomes.
Excellent level of English.
Technical Proficiency:
Microsoft Power BI: Expertise in Power Query M, DAX, dataset modeling, reports, and dashboards design, with the ability to design prototypes to support requirements.
APIs: Understanding of REST APIs and SOAP APIs, with the ability to read and understand technical specifications.
Data Analysis and SQL: Strong expertise in data analysis and SQL programming.
UX/UI Design: Sound knowledge of UX/UI design for analytics solutions.
Version Control and CI/CD: Proficiency with Git and CI/CD (multi-branch approach).
Soft Skills:
Teamwork: Strong team worker with a delivery-focused mindset.
Agile Experience: Experience working within Agile teams.
Stakeholder Communication: Ability to articulate conversations with business stakeholders beyond the technical level discussion of the user stories.
Communication: Robust communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strategic Thinking: Strong strategic and problem-solving skills, with the ability to anticipate potential issues and create effective solutions.
Exceptional ability in data visualization and design, with a focus on crafting compelling data narratives.
Mastery in leveraging Business Intelligence tools to drive data analysis and strategic decision-making.


Connect your future to ours. Inspire. Dream. Play

Title: Data Analyst - Credit
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, we've helped 45+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
√önete como Data Analyst a una compa√±√≠a de elevada reputaci√≥n en el sector del comercio omnicanal, donde tu principal misi√≥n ser√° desarrollar e implementar soluciones de anal√≠tica de datos, asegurando su calidad y trazabilidad, y facilitando el acceso a conjuntos de datos que generen impacto en todas las √°reas de la compa√±√≠a.



¬øCu√°les ser√°n tus principales responsabilidades?

Crear y poner en producci√≥n datasets.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us :

As the European market leader, NEXTLANE develops and delivers digital solutions for the automotive industry by connecting the systems of manufacturers and dealers.

We develop integrated end-to-end software and digital solutions that digitize and simplify the entire automotive customer journey.

Our mission is to empower our clients to boost their business operations and optimize their customer experience through innovative solutions. Our comprehensive software suite revolutionizes every aspect of new and used vehicle sales and management.







üìã Context of the Position :

Primary function is to collect, analyze, and interpret data to help the company make informed and strategic decisions. Use data analytics tools to examine trends, patterns, and correlations that can influence business performance.




Work closely with other departments to identify areas for improvement and opportunities to optimize processes and increase operational efficiency. Develop reports and presentations that clearly and concisely communicate the results of the analyses to senior management and other key stakeholders.




The role reports directly to the Chief of Staff of the CEO, topics are then very diverse and exposition to senior leadership is a given.







üéØ Your responsibilities :

As a key member of our team, you'll be responsible for...




Collect and analyze data related to the automotive sector, including sales data, inventory, marketing, and other key performance indicators.
Identify trends and patterns in data to provide valuable insights to product development and marketing teams.
Create clear and concise reports and presentations to communicate findings to management and other departments.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to improve data-driven decision-making.
Develop and maintain predictive models and data analysis to enhance operational efficiency and increase company profitability.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and optimization based on data.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in data analysis and apply them in the company.







üïµÔ∏è What we are looking for :




Experience:

Bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, or a related field.

Experience and skills in data analysis is a must have

Experience and skills in data science and AI is a nice to have




Languages:

Fluent level of English

Professional competency in French is a nice to have




Technical Skills:

Statistics, databases and information systems.

Professional level of Excel and PowerBI (or similar)

Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools (SQL, R and Python‚Ä¶) is a nice to have

Any knowledge of automation or data platform tools (DBT,Alteryx, Knime, Make, Snowflake, Databricks‚Ä¶) is a nice to have




Soft Skills:

Ability to work independently and in a team.

Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Ability to manage multiple projects and meet established deadlines.







ü§ù Our Recruitment Process:

30-minute call with our Talent Acquisition Specialist.
Two interviews with our Hiring Managers to evaluate your technical and soft skills.




Join us and be part of the Nextlane adventure that is shaping the future of the automotive industry!







üíé Our Advantages

We value flexibility and trust within our corporate culture, offering benefits that reflect our commitment to our teams:

üè° Possibility to telework up to 3 days a week!

ü§ù ‚Ç¨600 referral bonus for each talent you capture. (after the 6-month trial period).

üç± Flexible Remuneration (COBEE).

üë© ‚öïÔ∏è Medical Insurance (Adeslas).

üìí Access to a dedicated internal training platform for continuous learning.

üå¥ 23 days of vacation. Intensive day July and August.







ü§ù Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging:




We are committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued in the workplace. We believe that the company and its culture are strongest when they are made up of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

We welcome applications from people with disabilities. If you are a person with a disability and need help, please let us know so we can talk about how we can best support and make any adjustments that may be necessary.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.







üåç What does it mean to work at Nextlane?




Join a young and fast-growing company, where you can work on new and ambitious projects.

International and multicultural environment.

Collaboration between colleagues.




We truly believe that Nextlane is a great place to work and develop your talent! Sign up for our offer and find out why.

Title: Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
ABOUT AXA




Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. From insurance to personal protection, and savings to wealth management, no matter the need we‚Äôre always there for them. And we‚Äôre always there for our employees. In 50 countries, we work hard to inspire pride and a sense of belonging in our people. To provide opportunities that challenge them, inspire them, and reward them. And to create a culture that‚Äôs open, supportive, and empowering. Because we know that‚Äôs the real secret to success ‚Äì and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.




Your work environment:




The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA) brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work.




Within the Group, you will join the newly created Global Chief Underwriting Office (GUO) in charge of establishing, enabling, and driving profit and growth through Insurance Product Underwriting Strategy, Portfolio Design and Technical Underwriting Excellence & monitoring in partnership with the AXA Entities, for all lines of Business.




Data is a key part of AXA‚Äôs Strategic Plan ‚ÄúUnlock the Future‚Äù and the transformation of the organization as a Data Driven company. To succeed in this journey, we are looking for our Data Portfolio Analyst.




If you ‚Ä¶

Are a data-driven and a data passionate person,
Driven by value creation through data use and projects,
Eager to learn every day something new and meeting challenges

‚Ä¶this position is made for you!







Your job and daily missions:

P&C Commercial Line Group Underwriting Office is looking for a ‚ÄúData Portfolio Analyst‚Äù to join the Business Performance team. The Data Portfolio Analyst will play a key contributing role in ensuring Data assets meet objectives in terms of Quality, Timeline & Benefits:

Support P&C CL Underwriting teams in their strategic initiatives related to data framework/governance implementation in various P&C business processes: P&C Technical Performance Monitoring, Natural Catastrophes data Management across the Group (NatViews), Energy Transition & Sustainability (e.g. ESG),‚Ä¶
Lead / Participate to transversal projects & use cases related to Data Mesh and Gen AI, and be a Data Governance referent, working closely with Data Owners (Finance, Risk, Underwriting, entities,‚Ä¶) and Data Stewards (Technology & Data teams, Corporate Data Center,‚Ä¶) to answer their questions, provide orientations and ensure data framework is enforced
Perform data cartography and mapping exercises with business teams in order to document the relevant processes, technical storage items (tools) and relevant data to be included in our data governance framework
Collaborate with data transversal stakeholders (Group Risk Management, Group Finance, AXA Group Operations,‚Ä¶) to ensure global alignment on data policy and effective usage by P&C CL operational teams
Master tool capabilities both from an end-user perspective (browsing, search, views‚Ä¶) and from an admin one (import/export data, data quality review, access rights management‚Ä¶)
Promote data culture across Group Underwriting Office and contribute to the improvement of data maturity through diverse communication formats and events







Let‚Äôs talk about you:




Master‚Äôs degree in business or engineering, with a business data orientation
Around 3 to 5 years‚Äô experience as a Data / BI business analyst. Experience in Insurance and/or Consulting would be appreciated.
Knowledge in data projects management, ideally in major and multi-cultural organizations with large-scale data.
Fluency in English, verbal and written
Good data processing/visualization and technical skills, with confirmed knowledge of Excel, SQL, BI tools (e.g. PowerBI & Tableau), Python, R
Computer literate including Microsoft Office Package
Inquisitive mind with compelling analytical thinking skills
Ability to work with team globally located and cross-functionally, with entrepreneurial spirit and ambition to drive change







What we offer




You will join:




A company with an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce, committed to attract, develop, advance, and retain the most diverse talents, while creating an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and can reach their highest potential.
A company with strong values
A company promoting internal mobility and the training of its employees
A company offering many benefits (learn more here: Reward & Benefits | AXA Group)A flexible company, allowing hybrid work, in the office and from home
A responsible company, towards people, including its employees and customers, and towards the planet




As part of your job application, your personal data will be processed by GIE AXA - 23 avenue Matignon 75008 France. For more information about the processing of your personal data, please refer to the candidate information notice (link).

HTML:
ABOUT AXA


Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. From insurance to personal protection, and savings to wealth management, no matter the need we‚Äôre always there for them. And we‚Äôre always there for our employees. In 50 countries, we work hard to inspire pride and a sense of belonging in our people. To provide opportunities that challenge them, inspire them, and reward them. And to create a culture that‚Äôs open, supportive, and empowering. Because we know that‚Äôs the real secret to success ‚Äì and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.


Your work environment:


The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA) brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work.


Within the Group, you will join the newly created Global Chief Underwriting Office (GUO) in charge of establishing, enabling, and driving profit and growth through Insurance Product Underwriting Strategy, Portfolio Design and Technical Underwriting Excellence & monitoring in partnership with the AXA Entities, for all lines of Business.


Data is a key part of AXA‚Äôs Strategic Plan ‚ÄúUnlock the Future‚Äù and the transformation of the organization as a Data Driven company. To succeed in this journey, we are looking for our Data Portfolio Analyst.


If you ‚Ä¶

  • Are a data-driven and a data passionate person,
  • Driven by value creation through data use and projects,
  • Eager to learn every day something new and meeting challenges

‚Ä¶this position is made for you!



Your job and daily missions:

P&C Commercial Line Group Underwriting Office is looking for a ‚ÄúData Portfolio Analyst‚Äù to join the Business Performance team. The Data Portfolio Analyst will play a key contributing role in ensuring Data assets meet objectives in terms of Quality, Timeline & Benefits:

  • Support P&C CL Underwriting teams in their strategic initiatives related to data framework/governance implementation in various P&C business processes: P&C Technical Performance Monitoring, Natural Catastrophes data Management across the Group (NatViews), Energy Transition & Sustainability (e.g. ESG),‚Ä¶
  • Lead / Participate to transversal projects & use cases related to Data Mesh and Gen AI, and be a Data Governance referent, working closely with Data Owners (Finance, Risk, Underwriting, entities,‚Ä¶) and Data Stewards (Technology & Data teams, Corporate Data Center,‚Ä¶) to answer their questions, provide orientations and ensure data framework is enforced
  • Perform data cartography and mapping exercises with business teams in order to document the relevant processes, technical storage items (tools) and relevant data to be included in our data governance framework
  • Collaborate with data transversal stakeholders (Group Risk Management, Group Finance, AXA Group Operations,‚Ä¶) to ensure global alignment on data policy and effective usage by P&C CL operational teams
  • Master tool capabilities both from an end-user perspective (browsing, search, views‚Ä¶) and from an admin one (import/export data, data quality review, access rights management‚Ä¶)
  • Promote data culture across Group Underwriting Office and contribute to the improvement of data maturity through diverse communication formats and events



Let‚Äôs talk about you:


  • Master‚Äôs degree in business or engineering, with a business data orientation
  • Around 3 to 5 years‚Äô experience as a Data / BI business analyst. Experience in Insurance and/or Consulting would be appreciated.
  • Knowledge in data projects management, ideally in major and multi-cultural organizations with large-scale data.
  • Fluency in English, verbal and written
  • Good data processing/visualization and technical skills, with confirmed knowledge of Excel, SQL, BI tools (e.g. PowerBI & Tableau), Python, R
  • Computer literate including Microsoft Office Package
  • Inquisitive mind with compelling analytical thinking skills
  • Ability to work with team globally located and cross-functionally, with entrepreneurial spirit and ambition to drive change



What we offer


You will join:


  • A company with an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce, committed to attract, develop, advance, and retain the most diverse talents, while creating an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and can reach their highest potential.
  • A company with strong values
  • A company promoting internal mobility and the training of its employees
  • A company offering many benefits (learn more here: Reward & Benefits | AXA Group)A flexible company, allowing hybrid work, in the office and from home
  • A responsible company, towards people, including its employees and customers, and towards the planet


As part of your job application, your personal data will be processed by GIE AXA - 23 avenue Matignon 75008 France. For more information about the processing of your personal data, please refer to the candidate information notice (link).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are




At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!




Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world‚Äôs leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of AON, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?




About the role




As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for building robust analytical platforms to support data-driven initiatives across the company. In this role, you will deliver strategic analysis on high priority initiatives across the entire organization. You will be working closely with Product, Marketing, Sales, and Operations in providing them with visibility to real-time data. You will be expected to deliver data-driven insights that will play an integral role in defining the company‚Äôs data model.




A typical day




Use Looker to build critical dashboards that will measure business performance, hold teams accountable, and generate insights.
Democratize data through skillful data structuring by developing Looker explores to support our internal stakeholders.
Own data analysis and visualization, and communicate the outcomes/insights to various stakeholders that will be utilized to make strategic decisions for improvements.
Partner with the Analytics and Data Engineering teams to understand current problems with our existing data platform, identity solutions, and deliver high quality data foundations to data stakeholders across multiple business lines.
Work cross-functionally with Product, Sales, Operations, and Marketing to provide them with visibility to real-time data on existing and new processes.




What you need to succeed




About 2 - 4 years of experience in a data analyst role.
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative field.
Highly proficient in SQL
Experience using visualization tools, preferably Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Experience working in Agile environments, preferably with Jira.
Extra Credit - Exposure to data modeling and transformation tools like dbt and experience with data analysis and building data pipelines with Python.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Problem solver with excellent analytical skills.
Hability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong quantitative reasoning skills and experience using data to provide insights to executive leadership and other departments.




About the recruitment process




Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
Do we have a match? Let‚Äôs move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the leaders from our amazing Data Analytics Team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day and their responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Analyst as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level on SQL and you will have a maximum of 4 days to complete it.
If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet our Head of Data, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.




Why CoverWallet




At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations. And just for good measure‚Ä¶




üí∞ Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
‚è∞ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it‚Äôs up to you!
üéÅ Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
üìö Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500‚Ç¨ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
üõí Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
üèù 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
üçè Great office in Madrid, where you will find all the coffee, drinks, snacks and fruit you want. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)

Who We Are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!

Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world‚Äôs leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are an Aon company, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mentality and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what could we ask more?

About The Role

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for building robust analytical platforms to support data-driven initiatives across the company. In this role, you will deliver strategic analysis on high priority initiatives across the entire organization. You will be working closely with Product, Marketing, Sales, and Operations in providing them with awareness of real-time data. You will be expected to deliver data-driven insights that will play an integral role in defining the company‚Äôs data model.

A typical day

  • Use Looker to build critical dashboards that will measure business performance, hold teams accountable, and generate insights.
  • Democratize data through strategic data structuring by developing Looker explores to support our internal collaborators.
  • Own data analysis and visualization, and communicate the outcomes/insights to various collaborators that will be utilized to make strategic decisions for improvements.
  • Partner with the Analytics and Data Engineering teams to understand current problems with our existing data platform, identity solutions, and deliver high quality data foundations to data stakeholders across multiple business lines.
  • Work cross-functionally with Product, Sales, Operations, and Marketing to provide them with visibility to real-time data on existing and new processes.

What You Need To Succeed

  • About 2 - 4 years of experience in a data analyst role.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative field.
  • Highly proficient in SQL
  • Experience using visualization tools, preferably Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
  • Experience working in Agile environments, preferably with Jira.
  • Extra Credit - Exposure to data modeling and transformation tools like dbt and experience with data analysis and building data pipelines with Python.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Problem solver with excellent analytical skills.
  • Hability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Strong quantitative reasoning skills and experience using data to provide insights to executive leadership and other departments.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint ‚Äì join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.

We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues‚Äô safety at the heart of our organization.

How To Contribute To Our Vision

As our Data Analyst in PPA you research, analyze, consolidate and interpret data using statistical and data analytics methods, providing our internal customers full insight on product reliability, quality and performance, end-to-end throughout the whole value chain. Within a cross-functional team, you manage the alignment with our interfaces and stakeholders within TE and across SGRE, especially in the Business Units and the Corporate Quality function.

Mission Of The Function

PPA‚Äôs mission is ensure a robust, sustainable, and effective approach of bringing awareness on design- and product quality to the TE organization, allowing them to prioritize efforts based on business impact criteria‚Äôs and thereby ensuring SGRE can launch high quality products on the market.

Main Responsibilities Of The Position Are


Drive consolidation of product reliability, quality and performance data from various data sources throughout the value chain (manufacturing, installation, commissioning, service)
Be the focal point inside within our Technology team regarding reliability and quality KPIs, developing the technical knowledge across the product platforms
Validate and interpret data to provide context to product quality and performance KPIs, identify trends and correlations, as well as financial implications
Analyze fleet data, support product designers to identify measures to ensure required reliability
Create reports and communicate to various stakeholders (e.g. product platform managers and TE management), ensuring awareness on design- and product quality
Collaborate with data analysts in teams across the company


Position Qualifications And Required Skills


Academic degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics or similar
Work experience of 2-5 years in data analytics
International work experience e.g., as part of an international project team or working abroad including strong English proficiency
General broad understanding of- and interest in technology and underlying principles
Good communication skills are required to discuss analysis and results.


What You Need To Make a Difference


Analytical mind with a problem-solving attitude and strong communication- and project management skills
You are committed to deadlines and show ownership on your assignments
You are Team-player with a can-do attitude, open to feedback from peers and managers and willingness to learn and develop
You must be able to work independently in cross-functional initiatives with a variety of stakeholders and work effectively at all levels in an organization
You have a strong quality and result orientation


In return of your commitment we offer you‚Ä¶


Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come
A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy
Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality
Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization
Flexible working hours as well as home-office (depending on the position, legal entity or responsibilities)
Attractive remuneration package
Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more


Empowering our people

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

How do you imagine the future?

https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY

Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions ‚Äì the greatest challenge we face.

Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. We have inclusive recruiting processes specifically for severely disabled persons in Spain and we do our utmost to tailor working spaces to suit your individual needs. In cases of severe disability, applicants who are equally qualified will be given preferential consideration.

Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.



We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.

Title: Data Analyst (Online Sales)
Description:

Title: Associate Data Analyst (6 months)
Description:
EA inspires the world to play, and the Worldwide Localization Team makes that happen! We are accountable for delivering the high-quality localized versions of our titles to over 30 countries around the world. You will find a vibrant, multicultural environment with a great mixture of professionals. From software engineers, project managers, testers to audio, text and linguistic specialists, each employee has an important role to play. EA has built a cutting-edge Localization powerhouse that covers the needs for both current and next-generation platform.

We are hiring a Data Analyst for our Localization Data & AI team. Loc Data & AI¬¥s mission is to support and foster the use of data from all perspectives, along with developing policies and procedures for the monitoring and active management of data in EA Localization. Data Analysts of EA have to think critically to tackle complex challenges and thrive in a fast-paced environment where they have an immediate impact on the business.

We are looking for someone passionate about applying data analytics to real-world problems. He/She will help us research and solve new problems, so we‚Äôre looking for someone who has the creativity to explore new solutions and the drive to see their project through to completion. As a Data Analyst at EA, you will work closely with your mentor to learn about your project, receive guidance, and share your work. You‚Äôll have opportunities to meet other Data Analyst at EA and work with stakeholders.

Responsibilities


Collaborating with business leaders/partners to identify key performance indicators to track, analyze, and understand why this data is important and how it should help inform business decisions.
Translating business requirements into a data collection and analysis strategy.
Analyzing data using statistical modeling, predictive modeling, and other data analysis techniques
Communicate and present results to business leaders, product managers, analysts, and others throughout the organization.
Implement and share new methodologies.


Qualifications


At least three years of relevant experience
Experience with applied statistics and advanced analytics.
Strong experience in SQL
Experience with Python
Strong data modeling experience
Strong communication skills with the ability to create compelling stories for executives.
Experience working directly with data consumers to fulfil their needs.
Strong ability to build partnerships and collaboration across teams.
Ability to drive projects through to completion.
Interest in games is a big plus.
Ability to work independently.


Connect your future to ours. Inspire. Dream. Play.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst‚Äì Data Science & BI (ODS)
Description:
Country: Spain

Business Intelligence Data Analyst‚Äì Data Science & BI (ODS)

Open Digital Services is a tech company with a unique culture, dedicated to creating innovative products for Santander Group Affiliates. Open Digital Services is part of the Retail & Commercial Division of Santander Group, one of the world's largest financial institutions and the Eurozone's leader, we're committed to being the best Digital Bank with Branches in the industry.

Our mission at ODS is to design and support an advanced digital and omnichannel platform, ensuring the best customer experience using cutting-edge technology. Openbank, our flagship partner, is where we develop our most advanced concepts. Be part of our Best-in-Class tech team and help us create unique value for our customers!

Join us to tackle exciting tech challenges in an agile environment, benefiting from learning, growth, and local and international career opportunities in a modern, diverse setting.

Mission and responsibilities:

We are seeking an innovative and passionate Data Analyst to build a reference Business Intelligence Platform of the newly created function created within the Retail & Commercial Unit for Santander.

One of the main products will be the creation of dashboards that will serve as the central hub for our financial operations across multiple countries, providing critical insights and fostering data-driven decision-making. You will report to the product owner and work closely with other data analysts, data engineers, and stakeholders from various departments to ensure the dashboard meets the needs of our global business.

The main tasks of this position will be the following:


Collecting and interpreting data from different sources in our AWS Datalake.
Analysing results from different commercial actions and drive insights that can lead to optimizing our business.
Reporting the results back to the relevant members of the business, using data visualization tools.
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets, as well as automate these tasks so we can spend less time reviewing normality and more time analyzing interesting anomalous patterns.
Defining new data collection and analysis processes from our different business verticals.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Ability to identify and automate recurring tasks (through scripts or dashboards).
Create a repository of key queries (really useful queries could be interesting for the rest of the team and for your future work).
Generate documentation of all the processes to facilitate their understanding, transfer or backup.


To be successful in the role you must have:


+5-8 years of experience in a similar role.
Computational Skilled Degree (Computer Science, Telecomm., etc..)
Statistical analysis: you know the basic statistical concepts and know how to implement them in different programming languages (ideally Python or Spark, and less ideally R üòâ). You know when to use different indicators and have experience summarizing data insights with them.
Dealing with large datasets and implementing scalable solutions. You know what data cleaning means and how to interact with a data engineer.
How to solve problems using data: analyze the problem and decompose it into different analytical components and recycle all the components you can from other projects.
Software development: you know what git means, and how to develop your own code, test it and use it to produce actionable results. Open-source lovers get a plus if you show us your github!
Data Visualization, and tools like Power BI (highly appreciated), matplotlib, tableau, or similar. Bonus points for QuickSight.
You are an SQL-ninja, writing simple exploratory or efficient queries won't be a problem for you.


What do we offer?


Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

ODS is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status.

We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build.

The personal data you provide as well as any data generated during the selection process are confidential and will be processed by Open Bank, S.A./ Open Digital Services, S.L. with registered office at Plaza de Santa B√°rbara 2, 28004 (Madrid), for the sole purpose of managing your participation in the selection processes and, where appropriate, to formalise your recruitment.‚ÄØ

For further information about your rights and data protection, please read the ODS/Openbank Privacy Policy applicable to this type of data processing here.‚ÄØ

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Type: Full-time

Location: Madrid, Paris, or London

What about us?

Welcome to INFINIT, a global tech company supercharging SMEs in select verticals with a unified platform that combines AI-powered business services with banking, operating systems, and deep industry expertise. Our mission is to help businesses grow simply by offering a comprehensive suite of solutions tailored to their unique needs.

At INFINIT, we are transforming vertical banking for SMEs with our advanced technology and industry knowledge, delivering solutions that drive growth and efficiency. We pride ourselves on innovation, transparency, and building strong relationships with our clients.

Join us at INFINIT as we reshape the landscape of business services, making a positive impact on the global economy. Your adventure in fintech starts here!

As a Data Analyst, you will be instrumental in analyzing data to drive strategic decisions and enhance our products and services. You will collaborate closely with operational and engineering teams to optimize operational efficiency and scalability, enabling our solutions to support larger volumes effectively.

What do we want to achieve together?



Structured Projects: Create and execute structured projects that drive growth and success, leveraging data insights to optimize business processes
KPI Management: Excel in defining and managing Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that provide actionable insights and steer our business strategy
Tools Administration: Administer and optimize tools and systems like CRM and analytics platforms to maximize operational effectiveness
Process Automation: Innovate and streamline processes through automation to improve efficiency and scalability
Strategic Initiatives: Handle strategic tasks that introduce best practices and ensure long-term business success
Data Analysis Mastery: Master the art of data analysis and management to extract valuable insights for decision-making




What do you need to be successful in this role?



Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Business, or equivalent field
Experience: Up to 4 years of experience in a relevant data-focused role
Language Skills: Fluency in English; proficiency in Spanish is advantageous
Stakeholder Management: Proficient in managing stakeholders to achieve common goals and drive projects forward
Tools Proficiency: Strong proficiency in Excel; familiarity with Power BI, SQL, or willingness to learn
Analytical Mindset: Ability to synthesize data and provide valuable insights to support data-driven decision-making
Adaptability: Capable of maintaining composure in fast-paced environments with tight deadlines
Effective Planning: Strong organizational and planning skills to execute tasks efficiently
Results Orientation: Autonomous and driven by achieving tangible results




What will you find working at Infinit:



Inspiring Mission: We are dedicated to revolutionizing business financing and making a positive impact on the European economy. Your work at Infinit will have a lasting effect on businesses and communities
Diverse and Inclusive Team: Join a dynamic and international team of over 7 nationalities. You'll have the chance to work with experienced professionals from around the world, fostering a rich learning environment
Flexibility and Ownership: we trust our team and we are goal-oriented
Competitive salary and stock options. We offer highly competitive salaries and equity, because we're building this together
Day off on your birthday we celebrate it with you
Flexible Benefits: Access Flexible Retribution benefits through a convenient mobile app
Quality Time Together: We foster a sense of community with annual gatherings and bi-weekly office team gatherings. You're more than welcome to join us for quality time
Health and Well-being: Your health matters to us so we cover you! You will have access to top-quality Medical & Mental Health Insurance
Personal Time Off: Enjoy flexibility with your personal time off




Diversity & Inclusion

Infinit promotes an inclusive culture that seeks equity and values different perspectives. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!

Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world‚Äôs leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are an Aon company, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mentality and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what could we ask more?

About The Role

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for building robust analytical platforms to support data-driven initiatives across the company. In this role, you will deliver strategic analysis on high priority initiatives across the entire organization. You will be working closely with Product, Marketing, Sales, and Operations in providing them with awareness of real-time data. You will be expected to deliver data-driven insights that will play an integral role in defining the company‚Äôs data model.

A typical day


Use Looker to build critical dashboards that will measure business performance, hold teams accountable, and generate insights.
Democratize data through strategic data structuring by developing Looker explores to support our internal collaborators.
Own data analysis and visualization, and communicate the outcomes/insights to various collaborators that will be utilized to make strategic decisions for improvements.
Partner with the Analytics and Data Engineering teams to understand current problems with our existing data platform, identity solutions, and deliver high quality data foundations to data stakeholders across multiple business lines.
Work cross-functionally with Product, Sales, Operations, and Marketing to provide them with visibility to real-time data on existing and new processes.


What You Need To Succeed


About 2 - 4 years of experience in a data analyst role.
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative field.
Highly proficient in SQL
Experience using visualization tools, preferably Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Experience working in Agile environments, preferably with Jira.
Extra Credit - Exposure to data modeling and transformation tools like dbt and experience with data analysis and building data pipelines with Python.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Problem solver with excellent analytical skills.
Hability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong quantitative reasoning skills and experience using data to provide insights to executive leadership and other departments.

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:

Se podr√° teletrabajar 100% en remoto.

Conocimientos de modelado de datos DWH
Modelado y limpieza de datos con Power Query.
Elaboraci√≥n y mantenimiento de informes.
Comprobaci√≥n de datos con SQL Server.
Buenas experiencia en leguaje DAX.
Valorable: Azure, Snowflake, DBT

Dinamismo para abordar las tareas complejas.

Analizar los requerimientos de los proyectos por parte del cliente, y enfocarse en la parte de an√°lisis y desarrollo de dashboards en Power BI.







Y adem√°s, que m√°s te ofrecemos?




¬∑ 22 d√≠as de vacaciones, 2 d√≠as de libre disposici√≥n + 24 y 31 de Diciembre (cierre de empresa)




¬∑Te podr√°s beneficiar de un completo programa de beneficios y descuentos (ocio, tecnolog√≠a, bienestar y salud). ¬øQuieres ejemplos? Tienes infinitas posibilidades desde contratar Gympass o Fisio-Empresas, pasando por ofertas en m√≥viles y port√°tiles, hasta descuentos para irte de viaje, reservar un vuelo o pillar un alquiler de coche ¬°T√∫ elijes!

¬∑Participaci√≥n en eventos tecnol√≥gicos. Nosotros somos patrocinadores de eventos como el Codemotion, t3chfest y sobre todo estamos orgullosos de ser los organizadores de eventos t√©cnicos como el blockchain spain y DevOps Spain.




¬∑Nos acordamos de ti en los momentos importantes de tu vida (aniversario de trabajo, cumplea√±os y nacimiento). ¬°Tienes sorpresa asegurada!

¬∑Tienes acceso a nuestros meetups, techdays y a nuestro blog tecnol√≥gico ¬øTodav√≠a no conoces https://enmilocalfunciona.io/?

Trabajamos en entornos agile, flexible, con m√°xima conciliaci√≥n y teletrabajo y equipos horizontales de trabajo con una cultura de colaboraci√≥n, compromiso e innovaci√≥n.




En knowmad mood nos rodeamos de un buen ambiente y buena gente, donde se rema en la misma direcci√≥n para que todas las personas desarrollen su carrera profesional. Somos un ecosistema de talento y de oportunidades, podr√°s dirigir tu desarrollo profesional y tener conversaciones con tus responsables para localizar experiencias profesionales que consoliden tus nuevos conocimientos.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint ‚Äì join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.

We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues‚Äô safety at the heart of our organization.

How To Contribute To Our Vision

As our Data Analyst in PPA you research, analyze, consolidate and interpret data using statistical and data analytics methods, providing our internal customers full insight on product reliability, quality and performance, end-to-end throughout the whole value chain. Within a cross-functional team, you manage the alignment with our interfaces and stakeholders within TE and across SGRE, especially in the Business Units and the Corporate Quality function.

Mission Of The Function

PPA‚Äôs mission is ensure a robust, sustainable, and effective approach of bringing awareness on design- and product quality to the TE organization, allowing them to prioritize efforts based on business impact criteria‚Äôs and thereby ensuring SGRE can launch high quality products on the market.

Main Responsibilities Of The Position Are


Drive consolidation of product reliability, quality and performance data from various data sources throughout the value chain (manufacturing, installation, commissioning, service)
Be the focal point inside within our Technology team regarding reliability and quality KPIs, developing the technical knowledge across the product platforms
Validate and interpret data to provide context to product quality and performance KPIs, identify trends and correlations, as well as financial implications
Analyze fleet data, support product designers to identify measures to ensure required reliability
Create reports and communicate to various stakeholders (e.g. product platform managers and TE management), ensuring awareness on design- and product quality
Collaborate with data analysts in teams across the company


Position Qualifications And Required Skills


Academic degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics or similar
Work experience of 2-5 years in data analytics
International work experience e.g., as part of an international project team or working abroad including strong English proficiency
General broad understanding of- and interest in technology and underlying principles
Good communication skills are required to discuss analysis and results.


What You Need To Make a Difference


Analytical mind with a problem-solving attitude and strong communication- and project management skills
You are committed to deadlines and show ownership on your assignments
You are Team-player with a can-do attitude, open to feedback from peers and managers and willingness to learn and develop
You must be able to work independently in cross-functional initiatives with a variety of stakeholders and work effectively at all levels in an organization
You have a strong quality and result orientation


In return of your commitment we offer you‚Ä¶


Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come
A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy
Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality
Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization
Flexible working hours as well as home-office (depending on the position, legal entity or responsibilities)
Attractive remuneration package
Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more


Empowering our people

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

How do you imagine the future?

https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY

Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions ‚Äì the greatest challenge we face.

Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. We have inclusive recruiting processes specifically for severely disabled persons in Spain and we do our utmost to tailor working spaces to suit your individual needs. In cases of severe disability, applicants who are equally qualified will be given preferential consideration.

Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.



We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Business Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising!




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +10 countries & +230 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market + 400 Seedtaggers




YOUR CHALLENGE

You will get full ownership of our business data, and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyze the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratization of data inside the company, and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications / education in Data / Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders




It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modeling
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders




SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, Mexico..., üèñÔ∏è)

üçΩÔ∏èüöò Access to a flexible benefits plan with restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten tickets and discounts on medical insurance

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üèã Gympass

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues!




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.




Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!
