Title: Data Analyst, Finance & Strategy
Description:
About Gelato

Gelato has built the world's largest and most global network for on-demand production of customized items e.g. t-shirts, wall art, mugs, books, hoodies, and cards. We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs to sell their creativity globally, with a more local and sustainable production. With local production and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste, and carbon emissions are reduced.

We own no assets - we build the software that connects world-class production facilities all across the world. We have more than 130 production partners in 32 countries. In 72 hours we can reach more than 5 billion people with customized products in a smarter, faster, and greener way.

Gelato is changing the way that customized products can be produced on-demand. We are already empowering thousands of e-commerce entrepreneurs to grow and scale their businesses. With local production, and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste and carbon emissions are reduced.

Gelato consists of three different business units:

Optimalprint - our B2C e-commerce business, offering beautiful high-quality personalized products to consumers all over the world. The products are produced on-demand by Gelato‚Äôs local production network.

GelatoCreate - giving creators across the world instant access to a global market of customers. Simple integrations to webshops such as Shopify, Etsy and TikTok allow creators to connect and personalize their designs for a wide range of quality products, and Gelato takes care of the production and fulfillment through our local production.

GelatoConnect - the backbone of Gelato is enterprise software that powers the world's most advanced production on demand facilities, providing unmatched production workflow, logistics and procurement efficiency, quality management and cost savings.




What we are looking for

We are seeking analytics professionals with a passion for business impact to join our world class Finance & Strategy team. As a Data Analyst, you will help build strategic reports for investor and leadership teams and carry out analysis that will inform important financial and strategic decisions for Gelato. You will guide the finance team using data and insights by not simply presenting data, but telling data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your finance and strategy team members using clear insights and recommendations.

The position is based in Gelato‚Äôs offices in London (UK), Oslo (Norway), Stockholm (Sweden), and Madrid (Spain)

What you will be doing

Own the design, development, and maintenance of metrics, reports and dashboards to drive key business performance visibility for finance and strategy teams.
Identify trends & patterns using internal and external data sources powered with analytic models to provide actionable insights to business decision-makers.
Generate forecasts, recommendations, and strategic/tactical plans necessary to drive and influence business decision-making.
Share your knowledge and build creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practices.

Who you are

4 years+ of data analytics experience.
Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and integrity in all your analyses
Good time management. You can handle multiple tasks, meeting deadlines without compromising quality.
Collaborative. You work well in a team environment, collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong project and stakeholder management skills. You keep all stakeholders informed and manage expectations effectively.
Extensive hands-on experience in SQL.
Experience with data visualization and BI tools like Looker/Tableau/PowerBI.
Good knowledge of statistical analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with finance data or in finance related roles.
Advanced experience with Looker.
Experience in management consulting would be a plus.

What we offer

We offer you a chance to be part of a truly amazing journey in a company that sets very high targets and works hard to achieve them. You will be able to work with smart, motivated, and engaged co-workers from all over the world, in an intense and very energetic environment. This leads to you having a tangible impact on the way that we operate and expand our business.

Some of the highlights of the package include:

Strong technical culture of continuous innovation and improvement
Chance to become a shareholder of Gelato!
Flexible festive holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Work at one of our hub city offices or even remotely
And much much more!

What it‚Äôs like to work at Gelato

We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.

At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.

Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in English, regardless of which country you are applying from.

Title: Data Analyst - 100% Remote
Description:
Role Description

We are looking for the very Top Talent‚Ä¶and we would be delighted if you were to join our team!

More in details, UST is a multinational company based in North America, certified as a Top Employer and Great Place to Work company with over 35.000 employees all over the world and presence in more than 35 countries. We are leaders on digital technology services, and we provide large-scale technologic solutions to big companies.

What Are We Looking For

We are looking for Data Analyst who will contribute to a project with one of our global customers.

Your Main Responsibilities Include

Lead data model analysis initiatives, especially in the context of a data migration.

Must be able to investigate and propose data mapping solutions to fulfil target data models.

Key player on conversations with data Quality, data Owners and data Stewards, as well as Subject Matter Experts

Must be able to support test cycles to clarify doubts and resolve incidences.

Progress reporting to senior management

What are we looking for?

4yrs Working Experience As a Data Analyst

Experience in analysis and design of data collection systems.

Track record of developing high quality analysis that has resulted in successful data model definitions and migrations.

Maintains internal and external relationships ensuring compliance in all activities.

Good interpersonal skills and ability to work as a team member.

Good communication and ability to use different influencing styles.

Ability to tailor communication and leadership style to manage or influence colleagues.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.

What can we offer?


23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days!
Numerous benefits (Health Care Plan, teleworking compensation, Life and Accident Insurances).
Retribuci√≥n Flexible¬¥ Program: (Meals, Kinder Garden, Transport, online English lessons, Health Care Plan‚Ä¶)
Free access to several training platforms
Professional stability and career plans
UST also, compensates referrals from which you could benefit when you refer professionals.
The option to pick between 12 or 14 payments along the year.
Real Work Life Balance measures (flexibility, WFH or remote work policy, compacted hours during summertime‚Ä¶)
UST Club Platform discounts and gym Access discounts


If you would like to know more, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply and we‚Äôll get in touch to fill you in detail. We are waiting for you!

In UST we are committed to equal opportunities in our selection processes and do not discriminate based on race, gender, disability, age, religion, sexual orientation or nationality.

Skills


Data Analysis
English
100% Remote

Title: Analista de Reporting & BI
Description:
Description et exigences

Nombre de la vacante: Analista de Reporting & BI

N√∫mero de posici√≥n / avature: 60248626 / 11602

Centro de trabajo: Madrid

¬øTe apetece unirte a Endesa?

Estamos en b√∫squeda de una persona con experiencia en An√°lisis de data (SQL) y elaboraci√≥n de reporting para incorporarse como Analista de Reporting & BI para cubrir una vacante en Endesa ‚ÄúMadrid‚Äù

¬øQuieres ser t√∫? Te contamos un poco m√°s.

¬øQu√© se realiza en el √°rea?

Demanda y Precios (DyP) es un √°rea multidisciplinar perteneciente a la l√≠nea de negocio de Market que act√∫a como puente y enlace entre la actividad de comercializaci√≥n de Electricidad y Gas y la gesti√≥n de la energ√≠a necesaria para el suministro a nuestra cartera de clientes.

Con foco en las necesidades de Demanda y Precios en Espa√±a, Portugal y Francia, y asegurando el alineamiento con la Global Information and Communication Technology (ICT), el prop√≥sito de la Unidad DyP_Services es mejorar la productividad de los analistas de DyP a trav√©s de la optimizaci√≥n y automatizaci√≥n de los procesos; la identificaci√≥n, definici√≥n e implementaci√≥n de las herramientas de negocio; el gobierno, calidad e inteligencia de los datos, el reporting y el desarrollo de modelos de anal√≠tica avanzada; todo ello aportando sinergias, eficiencias y flexibilidad para alcanzar los objetivos de la Tribu de DyP. Realizamos la implementaci√≥n de estructuras de productos B2C y B2B necesarias para asegurar la formulaci√≥n, negociaci√≥n y operaci√≥n de las ofertas y la reingenier√≠a de los procesos de negocio para posibilitar a DyP el uso del ecosistema de plataformas digitales de Endesa. DyPS es el Focal Point de Demanda y Precios con ICT y Advanced Analytics de Market.

DyP_Services se estructura en cuatro servicios: Processes and Tools, Reporting y BI, Back Office y Modelos. Este puesto forma parte del segundo servicio.

Demanda y Precios es un √°rea que trabaja bajo el esquema de Tribu, promoviendo la liquidez de los recursos entre las distintas funciones, de acuerdo con la priorizaci√≥n continua de las necesidades del negocio. En el contexto actual, este puesto se configura como una posici√≥n t√©cnico-funcional vinculada a las funciones de Demand and Prices Services.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Lingokids' mission is to help 100 million families worldwide raise amazing kids through playlearning‚Ñ¢.




Through play and interactive technology, Lingokids delivers premium, modern learning through educational subjects and life skills so kids can thrive as confident, conscious, resilient, lifelong learners ‚Äî ready for school and today‚Äôs ever-changing world.




Are you ready for Playlearning?‚Ñ¢




We‚Äôre looking for an exceptional Product Data Analyst to join our team who is passionate about analysing data, identifying trends, and making recommendations to improve our growth strategies. As a key member of our team, you will work closely with Product Managers to improve user experience.




Responsibilities

Analyse user and interaction data to identify patterns, trends, and insights related to product usage and growth.
Collaborate with product managers to develop A/B testing strategies, implement tests, and analyse results to optimise product features and user flows.
Create reports and dashboards that track key performance indicators (KPIs) for product and monetisation.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to stakeholders based on data analysis to drive product improvements and growth strategy adjustments.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, tools, and practices related to product led growth and monetisation.
Own analytics projects E2E. Define business problems, translate into data approaches for yourself and more junior members of the team, and deliver insight and tools that will drive change.




Desired experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business, Marketing or a related field.
Proven experience working in a similar role, focusing on product or monetisation and data analysis in a fast growth business.
You have deep expertise in data focussed tools (e.g., SQL, Python) and techniques, and have a history of delivering impactful projects form from start to finish.
Experience with data analytics tools (e.g., Amplitude, Looker) and A/B testing tools and techniques.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and persuasive manner.
Self-starter with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Creative problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation.
You‚Äôre a bright, high calibre candidate who enjoys working in a warm, fast-paced and collaborative environment.




English is a must. We are a multicultural team, and we are providing a service in English so, we don't care about certificates, but we expect you to be able to communicate fluently.




You should feel equally comfortable communicating in long-form writing. We have become a fully remote company so, we believe that being articulate in both spoken and written long-form asynchronous communication is key to working efficiently together.




Experience working closely with non-technical stakeholders to refine requirements and bring them to life is a must.







Life at Lingokids

üè° Remote working: you can choose to work remotely from within your country or visit our offices if you live in Madrid.

‚öñÔ∏è Flexible hours and work-life balance: we care about the results you bring to the team. 9 to 6 and constant commuting is not for us either.

üìà Stock options: joining Lingokids means you can choose to own part of the company.

üåç Visa sponsorship: if you need a visa to work in the EU, Lingokids will assist you during the visa process, costs included.

üìö Professional growth: up to ‚Ç¨2.000 per year for conferences, books, and training.

üí¨ Language lessons: language learning is what we‚Äôre all about! We‚Äôll cover language classes for you to learn Spanish, English or Portuguese.

ü©∫ Health Insurance: we offer an optional health insurance through Adeslas, featuring competitive rates to ensure your well-being.

üß† Mental Health Support: we offer you 4 free TherapySide sessions to support your self-awareness and well-being

üí≥ Flexible compensation: you'll be able to include your monthly expenses in meals and transportations into your payroll (we use Cobee).

üç≤ Meal allowances: every month, you will receive a 60‚Ç¨ allowance on your Cobee card for you to spend on the restaurants and food delivery services.

üñ• Home office setup: you'll have a 400‚Ç¨ allowance in your first payroll to set up your home office and a 35‚Ç¨ monthly allowance for remote expenses.

üôå Feedback culture: feedback is the breakfast of champions, and we take it seriously! We have a real-time and honest feedback culture, and a formal 360¬∫ assessment every 6 months.




If you think you don't tick all the boxes, we'd still love to hear from you. Nobody checks every box, and we are looking for someone excited to join the team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Type: Full-time

Location: Madrid, Paris, or London

What about us?

Welcome to INFINIT, a global tech company supercharging SMEs in select verticals with a unified platform that combines AI-powered business services with banking, operating systems, and deep industry expertise. Our mission is to help businesses grow simply by offering a comprehensive suite of solutions tailored to their unique needs.

At INFINIT, we are transforming vertical banking for SMEs with our advanced technology and industry knowledge, delivering solutions that drive growth and efficiency. We pride ourselves on innovation, transparency, and building strong relationships with our clients.

Join us at INFINIT as we reshape the landscape of business services, making a positive impact on the global economy. Your adventure in fintech starts here!

As a Data Analyst, you will be instrumental in analyzing data to drive strategic decisions and enhance our products and services. You will collaborate closely with operational and engineering teams to optimize operational efficiency and scalability, enabling our solutions to support larger volumes effectively.

What do we want to achieve together?



Structured Projects: Create and execute structured projects that drive growth and success, leveraging data insights to optimize business processes
KPI Management: Excel in defining and managing Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that provide actionable insights and steer our business strategy
Tools Administration: Administer and optimize tools and systems like CRM and analytics platforms to maximize operational effectiveness
Process Automation: Innovate and streamline processes through automation to improve efficiency and scalability
Strategic Initiatives: Handle strategic tasks that introduce best practices and ensure long-term business success
Data Analysis Mastery: Master the art of data analysis and management to extract valuable insights for decision-making




What do you need to be successful in this role?



Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Business, or equivalent field
Experience: Up to 4 years of experience in a relevant data-focused role
Language Skills: Fluency in English; proficiency in Spanish is advantageous
Stakeholder Management: Proficient in managing stakeholders to achieve common goals and drive projects forward
Tools Proficiency: Strong proficiency in Excel; familiarity with Power BI, SQL, or willingness to learn
Analytical Mindset: Ability to synthesize data and provide valuable insights to support data-driven decision-making
Adaptability: Capable of maintaining composure in fast-paced environments with tight deadlines
Effective Planning: Strong organizational and planning skills to execute tasks efficiently
Results Orientation: Autonomous and driven by achieving tangible results




What will you find working at Infinit:



Inspiring Mission: We are dedicated to revolutionizing business financing and making a positive impact on the European economy. Your work at Infinit will have a lasting effect on businesses and communities
Diverse and Inclusive Team: Join a dynamic and international team of over 7 nationalities. You'll have the chance to work with experienced professionals from around the world, fostering a rich learning environment
Flexibility and Ownership: we trust our team and we are goal-oriented
Competitive salary and stock options. We offer highly competitive salaries and equity, because we're building this together
Day off on your birthday we celebrate it with you
Flexible Benefits: Access Flexible Retribution benefits through a convenient mobile app
Quality Time Together: We foster a sense of community with annual gatherings and bi-weekly office team gatherings. You're more than welcome to join us for quality time
Health and Well-being: Your health matters to us so we cover you! You will have access to top-quality Medical & Mental Health Insurance
Personal Time Off: Enjoy flexibility with your personal time off




Diversity & Inclusion

Infinit promotes an inclusive culture that seeks equity and values different perspectives. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic.

Description:

Title: Finance Data Analysis
Description:
About MAXAM

At MAXAM we work to offer our clients throughout the world a wide range of products and services, generating solutions, and full technical support to respond to their most specific needs.

Since our founding in 1872 by Alfred Nobel, MAXAM has grown by leaps and bounds. We are now a global company specializing in energy materials. We apply all our talent, energy and knowledge to the mining and civil engineering sectors, anywhere in the world. A lot has changed since Alfred Nobel started the business but some things haven¬¥t changed: our dedication to our people to achieve excellence in what we do.







What are we looking for?

A Junior Finance or Industrial engineer profile with data analytics skills to join the corporate team in Madrid. This position must perform the following tasks:




- Elaboration and analysis of the key projects monthly financial reporting (Sales/EBITDA, Gross margin, Trade working capital & overdues, etc.).

- Elaboration and monitoring of the projects operational KPI‚Äôs.

- Leading with Project Managers the definition and follow up of projects performance improvement plans.

- Elaboration, review and monitoring of projects Business Plans and scenario simulations.

- Modelling of processes and tools to help improve control over formulations.




Minimum requirements:

-Bachelor degree in Business Administration, Economics, Industrial Engineer or similar.

-Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.

-Previous experience in Audit Firm (Big Four) at least 1 year.

- Availability to travel.

- High level in MS Excel

- Experience with ERPs.

- Strong financial and accounting fundamentals.

- Experience in elaboration of Powerpoint presentations and experience in PowerBI is a plus.




Competencies:

Analitical capacity

Initiative

Teamwork

Pressure tolerance

Problem solving

Planning & organization




What we offer?

Permanent contract

Grow within a multinational environment

Flexible compensation package

Oficinas abiertas al mar: estamos en la Barceloneta frente al Mar Mediterr√°neo. Las vistas nos inspiran y el entorno nos permite disfrutar de una vida saludable: hacer deporte, llegar en bicicleta o caminando o comer al aire libre.

Valorable experiencia con dashboards en Tableau: Crear y mantener dashboards interactivos en Tableau que presenten m√©tricas clave del desempe√±o (conversiones, tr√°fico web, engagement) de manera visual y comprensible.

Title: Junior Data Analyst - FTC
Description:
Description

**Please note this is a 6 month Fixed Term Contract, starting ASAP **

Do you want to learn how the most complex transportation network is managed on a daily basis?

Our entire business is focused on delighting our customers. We strive to stay agile from the second an order is placed online and throughout the seamless coordination of that order behind the scenes. That can be described in one of our core Leadership Principles, which is Bias for Action. This means that our teams band together and aren‚Äôt content with just with the status quo. We‚Äôre aiming to become the most customer-centric company on Earth.

As a Logistics Scheduler you will have the opportunity to create world-class customer experiences leveraging your innovation, team player and problem solving skills.

This role covers 24/7 shifts that include fixed weekend days.

Key job responsibilities


Execute daily same day or next day forecasts.
Plan delivery routes or monitor the volume flow, affecting tens of thousands of packages at EU level.
You will be accountable for planning accuracy, cost and customer experience. In addition, you will be instrumental in developing best practices and standard work for the network.
Ensure targets and service deadlines are met, according to regulatory requirements.
Communicate with various departments, facilitating the flow of information between different stakeholders and resolving any potential issues that impact business continuity.
Conduct research into process improvement initiatives and taking real-time decisions by taking a step back at strategic intervals to take in the bigger picture.
Maintain and report up to date and accurate statistics, management reports and analysis.


A day in the life

This position is office-based 3 days per week, with the flexibility to work remotely up to two days per week in line with Amazon‚Äôs current flexible work guidance. Amazon encourages open communication about unique needs for flexible arrangements.

As a Logistics Scheduler you will work across the EU in a cross-functional environment with the Supply Chain, Distribution Centers, and Ground Transportation teams, in order to support our day-to-day operations to ensure the timely delivery of Heavy/Bulky shipments to our customers.

Relevant experience in an analytical tasks or projects, working with data
Advanced proficiency in verbal and written English (C1 in the Common European Framework of Reference, CEFR)
Relevant experience working with the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)


Preferred Qualifications


Preferred qualifications are not required to apply for a position at Amazon. If you have all the basic qualifications above, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.
Relevant experience in communicating with senior stakeholders and leadership
Previous experience within transportation or logistics
Working experience on programming and coding languages (SQL or Python).
Flexibility to work night shift if requested

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with proven experience in SQL, analytics and knowledge of statistics to join our Data Science Team. Working alongside our Data Engineers, the candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!

The role is based in Barcelona!

Your tasks and responsibilities:


Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to address strategic questions
Obtain and Report insights from our Product¬¥s performance (ML, Audiences, Creatives, Supply, etc) in order to make decisions that will impact revenue. Have one¬¥s say!
Develop automated dashboards and processes to ensure data influence decisions at all levels of the company
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance


Skills and requirements:


1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Proven working knowledge of SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Engineering or Business
Strong knowledge of basic statistics concepts
Strong analytical skills with the ability to get insights
Outstanding communication and reporting skills
Excellent command of Microsoft Excel (Power Pivot & Power Query)
Excellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatory
Strong experience with SQL for data exploratory analysis
Experience with A/B testing
Python/R, Superset, PowerBI experience is a plus
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus


Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:


Integrate a highly motivated and young team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbeque, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning
Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - TicketRestaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 26 countries
And more!

Title: Data Analytics Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We are seeking a skilled Data Analytics Analyst to support our data analysis and executive reporting initiatives. This position offers an opportunity to apply your expertise in data analytics while contributing to impactful projects within VTEX. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, excellent problem-solving skills, and a proven ability to drive insights in a dynamic environment.

Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and organize data from various sources to ensure data integrity.
Conduct in-depth quantitative analysis to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain data models and build beautiful dashboards using Power BI and Looker.
Generate comprehensive reports and presentations for internal stakeholders, providing clear and actionable recommendations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.
Continuously improve processes and tools to enhance data accuracy and reporting efficiency.


Who You Are


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Proficiency in Python and SQL for data analysis.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker and Power BI.
Proven ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
High attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality, accurate work.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively convey insights to stakeholders.
AWS Data Analytics Certification will be considered a plus.
If you have a portfolio, please share the link in your application. It will be considered a plus.


About VTEX

VTEX (NYSE: VTEX), the enterprise digital commerce platform for premier brands and retailers, is the leader in accelerating commerce transformation in Latin America and now expanding globally.

Our platform enables our customers to execute their commerce strategy, including building online stores, integrating and managing orders across channels, and creating marketplaces to sell products from third-party vendors. The VTEX platform is engineered to enterprise-level standards and features. We are trusted by more than 2,000 customers with over 2,500 active online stores across 32 countries, who rely on VTEX to connect with their consumers in a meaningful way. We have been the vendor of choice for numerous Fortune 500 companies in Latin America and are now becoming the global digital commerce vendor for enterprise brands, including Whirlpool, AB InBev, and Motorola.

According to IDC, VTEX is one of five vendors who "shaped the year 2020" and the fastest-growing digital commerce applications vendor in the top 20 market shares.

Benefits


Competitive compensation
Profit-sharing
Flexible work schedule
Possibility to join our equity program
Meal Allowance (Flash)
Transportation assistance
Health, dental, and life insurance
Child Care assistance
Extended parental leaves
Total partnership
Language scholarship: 65% subsidies in English, Spanish, Portuguese courses
Free shipping on 1000+ VTEX stores

Who we are

Quantion is a Business Digital Transformation services company born in 2015.




We have +120 professionals in application development, UX/UI and digital business transformation to build innovative solutions oriented to business results.




As a Digital Factory we combine our teams in cutting-edge technologies and digital deep experiences with the innovation ecosystem, to ensure that we can provide the best solution to face business challenges, from its concept to its implementation.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Technology team. If you want to participate in one of our biggest International projects, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!




What you will do:

You will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining data collection architecture, reports, metrics and analyses for different teams
You will juggling all kinds of data, collect and analyze them and seek for patterns and trends to drive the digital acceleration and future customer experience
You will utilize big data and business intelligence technologies to shape and drive key business decisions.
You'll make analysis results accessible by building and providing dashboards and reports based on business needs
You closely align with business and management teams to assess business needs

You will work pragmatically and support my team to deliver high quality solutions with speed
You will work in an international environment with a diverse team
You will work in an international environment with a highly diverse team

Ambition to master and not being intimidated by unstructured data and large datasets
Willingness to expand my comfort zone by sometimes leaving it
Very good command of English language

Title: Jr Finance Data Analyst ‚Äì Based in Barcelona
Description:
Company Description

Kaplan Language Group (KLG) is a reliable and respected leader in the language travel industry, that provides high-quality, language-travel programs across the world. The group consists of some of the biggest names in educational language tourism: Alpadia Language Schools, ESL Languages, and Kaplan International Languages. With more than 130 combined years of experience and thousands of happy and satisfied alumni ‚Äì KLG is a reliable and respected leader in the language travel industry.

KLG offers a wide range of language and cultural programs in more than 100 countries across the world, allowing students to embark on a unique, life-changing journey specifically tailored to them.

, Job Description

Position Summary

This is a position for the Reporting team that is integrated into the KLG FP&A team. Our goal is to give support to our main stakeholders by creating impactful power BI reports and giving analysis that would help and would have a direct impact on business profitability.

Main Responsibilities And Functions

The person in this Data Analyst role will be involved in


Day-to-day modeling, design, and development with Power BI.
You will provide commercial support to Finance and Operations teams (sales and customer care)
Translating business requirements into functional specifications, data source requirements, data extraction and data transformation
Assist in managing projects
Collect and manage a backlog of requirements, to allow the team to deliver business value in every sprint
Work closely with the report owners to test and evaluate the results of your reports


, Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business administration or Finance
Creative and adaptive mindset
At least 1-3 years of experience in Finance (FP&A, controlling, Finance Businnes Partner)
Experience in BI & analytics projects is desirable.
Knowledge of SQL Server Reporting Services would be a plus
Advanced level of Excel is a must.
Good command of written and spoken English.


Additional Information


What We Offer You:
The opportunity to develop your skills in an international environment, in the exciting field of language travel
Flexible working policy
A young and dynamic work atmosphere
An environment where corporate ethics and sustainable development matter
Competitive salary
Lunch vouchers
Free coffee and tea
Free breakfast on Mondays and fresh fruit on Thursdays
Language courses abroad
Medical insurance benefits discounts


Place of work: Barcelona (ES)

Reference: KLG_MKT

Type of contract:Permanent contract with 6 months trial period

Activity rate: Full time

With more than 130 combined years of experience and thousands of happy and satisfied alumni ‚Äì KLG is a reliable and respected leader in the language travel industry.

KLG offers a wide range of language and cultural programs in more than 100 countries across the world, allowing students to embark on a unique, life-changing journey specifically tailored to them.

, Job Description

Position Summary

This is a position for the Reporting team that is integrated into the KLG FP&A team. Our goal is to give support to our main stakeholders by creating impactful power BI reports and giving analysis that would help and would have a direct impact on business profitability.

Main Responsibilities And Functions

The person in this Data Analyst role will be involved in

  • Day-to-day modeling, design, and development with Power BI.
  • You will provide commercial support to Finance and Operations teams (sales and customer care)
  • Translating business requirements into functional specifications, data source requirements, data extraction and data transformation
  • Assist in managing projects
  • Collect and manage a backlog of requirements, to allow the team to deliver business value in every sprint
  • Work closely with the report owners to test and evaluate the results of your reports

, Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business administration or Finance
  • Creative and adaptive mindset
  • At least 1-3 years of experience in Finance (FP&A, controlling, Finance Businnes Partner)
  • Experience in BI & analytics projects is desirable.
  • Knowledge of SQL Server Reporting Services would be a plus
  • Advanced level of Excel is a must.
  • Good command of written and spoken English.

Additional Information

  • What We Offer You:
  • The opportunity to develop your skills in an international environment, in the exciting field of language travel
  • Flexible working policy
  • A young and dynamic work atmosphere
  • An environment where corporate ethics and sustainable development matter
  • Competitive salary
  • Lunch vouchers
  • Free coffee and tea
  • Free breakfast on Mondays and fresh fruit on Thursdays
  • Language courses abroad
  • Medical insurance benefits discounts

Place of work: Barcelona (ES)

Start date: ASAP

Reference: KLG_MKT

Type of contract:Permanent contract with 6 months trial period

Activity rate: Full time

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Kia Ora, Hola, ‡∏™‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏™‡∏î‡∏µ, Guten Tag!

WhereTo is a business travel startup from San Francisco that evolved into an agile development and design studio within the Flight Centre family. We build travel solutions used by some of the largest companies on the planet - we have just one goal: making business travel better for everybody.

WhereTo provides an AI-powered travel platform for corporate travel. Their platform uses machine learning algorithms to recommend personalized travel options based on a traveler's preferences, company policies, and budget. WhereTo's technology also allows for real-time travel tracking, reporting, and cost analysis, enabling companies to optimize their travel programs and reduce costs.

To learn more about WhereTo click HERE

About Your Opportunity

If you love data, this job is for you. We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated individual to take on the role of Level II Data Analyst. As a Level II Data Analyst, you will be responsible for advanced data analysis, development of complex reports and dashboards, and providing strategic insights to drive operational performance for our global business. This position requires expertise in data transformation, modeling, and reporting development. Join our fast-paced environment at WhereTo as a Level II Data Analyst and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of travel through data analysis and innovation.

A day in the life


Develop advanced visual reports, interactive dashboards, and KPI scorecards to provide in-depth insights into operational performance.
Collect and process vast amounts of data from multiple sources, employing advanced data transformation techniques to ensure usability and accuracy.
Generate ad hoc reports, complex datasets, and leverage database or data warehouse queries and scripts to extract information for end-users.
Integrate data from diverse sources and systems to produce comprehensive and requested data elements.
Conduct ad hoc analysis of business data, identifying patterns, trends, and anomalies to support decision-making.
Provide assistance and support to customers, addressing data integrity, validation questions, and resolving related queries.
Analyze data and trends and propose performance improvement measures to optimize operational efficiency.
Collaborate effectively with operations and engineering teams, participating in issue identification, estimation, prioritization, and resolution.
Comfortably operate within the Agile Scrum model, actively contributing to team meetings and sprint planning sessions.
Attend meetings with clients and stakeholders, presenting findings, insights, and recommendations with clarity and professionalism.



Experience & Qualifications


Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics) or related experience.
Strong communication skills required.
Strong experience working with analytics platforms such as mixpanel or similar required.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Superset, Tableau, etc
Experience with data analytics databases such as Druid.
Demonstrate a deep understanding of data relationships and a mastery of SQL syntax to perform advanced data retrieval and manipulation.
Exhibit exceptional analysis and design skills, critical thinking, and problemsolving abilities to tackle complex business challenges.
Experience in the DAX language, enabling the development of complex calculations and measures within Power BI a plus.
Prior experience working with travel data, understanding the unique challenges and requirements within the industry a plus.
Proficiency in Python or R, enabling advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and machine learning capabilities a plus.



Work Perks! - What‚Äôs in it for you:

FCTG is renowned internationally for having amazing perks and an even better culture. We understand that our people are our most valuable asset. It is the passion and dedication of our teams that keep the company on top of the industry ladder. It‚Äôs also why we offer some great employee benefits and perks outside of the norm.


Our fantastic offices are located in the heart of Barcelona, at Pla√ßa Catalunya.
The opportunity to join our free language lessons (English, French, Spanish or Catalan).
An attractive package: health insurance
25 days off/year + 5 compensation days + reduced time during summer + bank holidays.
Flexible working-time.
Table tennis on the terrace, a kitchen area with free snacks, fresh fruits and drinks.
The opportunity to work with an international and talented team.
Several activities organised by the ambassadors!

Title: Global Data Analyst
Description:
Who We are

Our mission is to ‚Äúmake the healthcare experience more human‚Äù. Docplanner is a SaaS tool for doctors and clinics used to optimize their patient flow, reduce no-shows, and digitize their practices to be able to spend more time with the patient. We also operate marketplace-websites in 12 countries which serve 62 million patients monthly to easily find the right doctor and book an appointment. Only last month 5 mln medical visits were booked via our websites. That makes us the world's leading marketplace connecting doctors and patients. We have been growing rapidly and are on a path to reach EUR 0.5 bln in ARR in the next 3-5 years!

Docplanner was founded in 2012 in Poland. Our team now numbers over 2000 people based across 9 offices in Warsaw, Munich, Barcelona, Istanbul, Rome, Mexico City, Curitiba, Rio de Janeiro and Bologna. It is backed by leading venture capital funds including Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Private Capital, and One Peak Partners, raising a total of ‚Ç¨130 million to date.

‚ÄúCulture eats strategy for breakfast‚Äù according to Peter Drucker. We believe in that. We‚Äôre looking for exceptional people who can help us change the world while building an amazing company. One of those is the Global Data Analyst, Sales Operations.



Job Description



Role Overview

Join us as the Global Data Analyst- Sales within our Global Sales Operations team whose main goal is to increase the Productivity of Sales and Expansion across all segments and markets. Reporting directly to the Global CSO, you will play a pivotal role in our organization. Your primary responsibility leverage data analytics to optimize sales strategies and expansion efforts. This includes conducting thorough data analysis, crafting and executing queries, developing strategic dashboards, participating in or leading machine learning projects, and evaluating A/B testing results to drive impactful business decisions.

What you will do:

Analyze and Communicate Data Insights: Thoroughly examine data sources to identify issues, interpret trends and patterns, and communicate these insights. Enhance your understanding of our database by studying other analysts' SQL queries, codes, and models.
Drive Innovation and Execution: Merge business insights with deep data understanding to develop new ideas. Execute these through writing optimized queries, calculating new metrics, building sophisticated reporting and operational monitoring systems, and creating both strategic and tactical dashboards.
Develop Machine Learning Models: Participate in the design and development of ML models, sharpening your skills in various decision-making algorithms to support and lead data-driven projects.
Lead A/B Testing Initiatives: Design, prepare, and analyze A/B tests, then communicate the results to business stakeholders to inform decision-making.


Qualifications



What will help you thrive:

3+ years of experience in data analytics or a similar role
Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Data Analysis, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics is preferred but not mandatory
Excellent critical thinking, comprehension, and communication skills
Proactive, results-oriented, with a hands-on approach to problem-solving
A good excellent understanding of SQL
An excellent understanding of data analysis in Python
Experience with data visualization solutions (i.e. Tableau, etc.)
Fluent in English (verbal and written)

Extra credit

You speak one additional language amongst the following: Portuguese, Spanish, Italian, Polish
You have some experience in Machine Learning


Additional Information



Logistics

In this role, you'll be reporting to Cem Yucelten (Global Chief Sales Officer)

This is a role on the Global Docplanner Team.

Process of getting to know each other (preliminary)

1. 30' minute Interview with A√Ønhoa Hameeuw (Global Talent Partner)
2. 60' minute Interview with Imanol Goicoechea (BI Analyst) & Jos√© Ghiringhelli (Project Manager)
3. Business Case to be prepared & presented to: Cem, Jos√© and Imanol
4. References & Offer

Benefits

Share options plan after six months working with us, vesting in 5 years (subject to separate ESOP agreement and plan)
Gym membership (reduced price)
Health Insurance paid by the company
Flexible retribution plan benefits
Mental health program (iFeel)
23 days of holiday per year (on top of bank holidays, plus your birthday off on top)

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you‚Äôre reading, there‚Äôs a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we‚Äôre lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you‚Äôve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other. ‚ù§Ô∏è

HTML:
Who We are

Our mission is to ‚Äúmake the healthcare experience more human‚Äù. Docplanner is a SaaS tool for doctors and clinics used to optimize their patient flow, reduce no-shows, and digitize their practices to be able to spend more time with the patient. We also operate marketplace-websites in 12 countries which serve 62 million patients monthly to easily find the right doctor and book an appointment. Only last month 5 mln medical visits were booked via our websites. That makes us the world's leading marketplace connecting doctors and patients. We have been growing rapidly and are on a path to reach EUR 0.5 bln in ARR in the next 3-5 years!

Docplanner was founded in 2012 in Poland. Our team now numbers over 2000 people based across 9 offices in Warsaw, Munich, Barcelona, Istanbul, Rome, Mexico City, Curitiba, Rio de Janeiro and Bologna. It is backed by leading venture capital funds including Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Private Capital, and One Peak Partners, raising a total of ‚Ç¨130 million to date.

‚ÄúCulture eats strategy for breakfast‚Äù according to Peter Drucker. We believe in that. We‚Äôre looking for exceptional people who can help us change the world while building an amazing company. One of those is the Global Data Analyst, Sales Operations.

Job Description

Role Overview

Join us as the Global Data Analyst- Sales within our Global Sales Operations team whose main goal is to increase the Productivity of Sales and Expansion across all segments and markets. Reporting directly to the Global CSO, you will play a pivotal role in our organization. Your primary responsibility leverage data analytics to optimize sales strategies and expansion efforts. This includes conducting thorough data analysis, crafting and executing queries, developing strategic dashboards, participating in or leading machine learning projects, and evaluating A/B testing results to drive impactful business decisions.

What you will do:

  • Analyze and Communicate Data Insights: Thoroughly examine data sources to identify issues, interpret trends and patterns, and communicate these insights. Enhance your understanding of our database by studying other analysts' SQL queries, codes, and models.
  • Drive Innovation and Execution: Merge business insights with deep data understanding to develop new ideas. Execute these through writing optimized queries, calculating new metrics, building sophisticated reporting and operational monitoring systems, and creating both strategic and tactical dashboards.
  • Develop Machine Learning Models: Participate in the design and development of ML models, sharpening your skills in various decision-making algorithms to support and lead data-driven projects.
  • Lead A/B Testing Initiatives: Design, prepare, and analyze A/B tests, then communicate the results to business stakeholders to inform decision-making.

Qualifications

What will help you thrive:

  • 3+ years of experience in data analytics or a similar role
  • Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Data Analysis, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics is preferred but not mandatory
  • Excellent critical thinking, comprehension, and communication skills
  • Proactive, results-oriented, with a hands-on approach to problem-solving
  • A good excellent understanding of SQL
  • An excellent understanding of data analysis in Python
  • Experience with data visualization solutions (i.e. Tableau, etc.)
  • Fluent in English (verbal and written)

Extra credit

  • You speak one additional language amongst the following: Portuguese, Spanish, Italian, Polish
  • You have some experience in Machine Learning

Additional Information

Logistics

In this role, you'll be reporting to Cem Yucelten (Global Chief Sales Officer)

This is a role on the Global Docplanner Team.

Process of getting to know each other (preliminary)

1. 30' minute Interview with A√Ønhoa Hameeuw (Global Talent Partner)
2. 60' minute Interview with Imanol Goicoechea (BI Analyst) & Jos√© Ghiringhelli (Project Manager)
3. Business Case to be prepared & presented to: Cem, Jos√© and Imanol
4. References & Offer

Benefits

  • Share options plan after six months working with us, vesting in 5 years (subject to separate ESOP agreement and plan)
  • Gym membership (reduced price)
  • Health Insurance paid by the company
  • Flexible retribution plan benefits
  • Mental health program (iFeel)
  • 23 days of holiday per year (on top of bank holidays, plus your birthday off on top)

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you‚Äôre reading, there‚Äôs a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we‚Äôre lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you‚Äôve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Title: Junior Business Insights and Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Business Environment

The Customer Support & Services Delivery (CSSD) Business Insights and Analytics is team within Digital and Transformation Organization focused on supporting CSSD Businesses with data, reports and insights to improve Customer experience and drive operational excellence through the right set of actionable metrics to accelerate innovation and transformation, in this case is specifically supporting Customer Care Center Organization.

Job Summary

This role is responsible for collecting, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting data to support decision-making and provide insights to the organization. The role works with large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations, helping businesses make informed choices and optimize their operations. The role utilizes various tools, techniques, and analytical skills to extract meaningful information from data and communicate their findings to non-technical stakeholders.

Responsibilities


Understanding business requirements, creating reports, analytics and business intelligence
Works with global reporting teams to set up and adapt standard reporting, based on business requirements.
Works together with Customer Care Center teams/internal customers to capture and met business requirements
Create reports and business intelligence to better understand operational performance of our Contact Centers
Provides insight on call drivers and customer satisfaction drivers
Analyze ways to avoid calls by providing solutions on the web
Identifies anomalies in data to enable issue prevention
Optimization and standardization
Identify improvement opportunities


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Work experience is not required, but appropriate internships related to the job content would be a plus.


Preferred Certifications


Programming Language/s Certification (SQL, Python, or similar)


Knowledge And Skills


Data Analysis, Data Management, Data Modeling, Data Quality, Data Science, Data Visualization and Data Warehousing
Using data collection and analysis tools and software packages to gather, integrate and analyze data from multiple sources.
Strong analytical, statistical and problem solving skills.
Understanding of industry quality standards and methodologies.
Using empirical and root- cause analysis, modeling, and testing methodologies to identify areas for process improvement.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English.
Ability to effectively communicate plans, proposals, and results, and negotiate options at different levels.


What We Offer


Opportunity to work in an international organization with colleagues coming from all over the world.
Diverse, continued internal growth and career opportunities. Including HP‚Äôs own learning platform and LinkedIn Learning.
An attractive benefits package:
Health & Life insurance
Lunch at reduced prices at our canteen/ ticket restaurant vouchers
HP product discount
Work life balance / flexible working hours.
Women, Pride, Young employees, Sustainability and DisAbility! Just a few of our fantastic global business networks you can get involved with locally.
We also dedicate time and resources to contribute with our community through Corporate Volunteering activities, including our onsite HP Charity day.
Do you like to give back to the community? Then join one of our many volunteering teams or be a part of the incredible HP charity day held on site annually.
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor) with 25+ regular coordinated‚ÄØactivities.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy, and general health.
Printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on‚ÄØworkshops‚ÄØto print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models.
Dedicated lactation room.
Our Women Network organizes activities such as Networking, the promotion of STEM vocations, talks on, improving business acumen, work life balance and skills of the future, etc.

Sounds like you? Apply and let‚Äôs have a talk!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone!

We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Marketing Data Analyst into our Analytics team.

Applying quantitative analysis, data science, statistics & programming, you‚Äôll draw business insights that add real value to Zynga and Socialpoint.

What will you do in Socialpoint?


Work with the Marketing and user Acquisition teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions.
Ensure the data that senior stakeholders use to support key decisions is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
Visualize and communicate the results of your data analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Debugging and problem-solving to ensure the quality and accuracy of your findings and metrics


Requirements


2-3+ years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value
A degree in a quantitative field, including hard sciences (e.g statistics, math, computer science or similar). Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field will also be valued.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.
Highly proficient in SQL and databases.
Basic Python skills for data analysis and automation tasks.
Experience using data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker‚Ä¶)
Excellent communication skills, know how to work in a team, prioritize and manage your own workload.
Passion for games, or high interest in the mobile gaming industry
Curiosity about everything & ability to innovate & work independently


Nice-to-haves


Experience in a mobile B2C business.
Experience implementing data science models with Python.
Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
Experience designing and analyzing randomized experiments
A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.


What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?


Hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office in Barcelona so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you‚Äôre not already here).
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays.
5 additional days annual leave on Christmas.
A very generous ticket-restaurant to restore some life-points.
Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons (English & Spanish ).
Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
Players develop‚Ä¶Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!


Benefits

Coming to work in the office? Don‚Äôt worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:


Want to stay in shape? We have state of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).


The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now! Please click ‚Äúapply‚Äù to level up and submit your application in English.

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You‚Äôre welcome on the team no matter where you‚Äôre from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It‚Äôs a trick question ‚Äì mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Find your place at Amaris Consulting as a Network Engineer in Barcelona. Start your new adventure in an international and agile Environment by identifying opportunities for improvement at the technical, functional, and organizational levels.




Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With a tailor-made career path, develop your skills and work on challenging projects for one of our more than 1000 clients across the globe. Being 6,350 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries you will feel part of our talented and international community. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information Systems & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences, and Engineering.




We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is in step with you to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.







üëâWHAT WILL YOU DO? üëà

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Listen to stakeholders and develop a deep understanding of their needs and priorities

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Prioritize needs coming from stakeholders

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Perform functional research and design to determine possible solutions

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Construct ad-hoc financial models and analyses to support deliverables

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Perform functional testing and user acceptance testing

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Conduct data discovery and profiling for fit and gap analysis

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Tenaciously solve problems and make decisions under uncertainty

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Actively contribute to team ceremonies including: sprint planning, daily stand-up, sprint review and retrospectives

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Demonstrate a strong ownership in understanding business needs and driving business valued outcome

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Communicate on outcomes to stakeholders to ensure understanding of progress and potential roadblocks.







üëâWHAT DO WE NEED? üëà




¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†University degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or equivalent

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†5+ years of accounting or finance experience

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†2+ years of hands on experience with SAP ECC or S/4

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Excellent proficiency with Microsoft Excel

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Comfortable writing SQL queries

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Passionate about learning everyday

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Customer satisfaction & Business oriented

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong communication skills

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience with PySpark

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Fluent in English




Preferred qualifications:

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience with AWS

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience with Databricks (or cloud-based data warehouse)







üöÄWHY US? üöÄ




We are people with dreams and motivations like you, desiring to work on projects that project us to the top and push us to improve ourselves to the best. Working next to super-talented people with whom we can share knowledge, and experiences, hang out and feel the support of our colleagues and managers. We care about our consultants, and that‚Äôs why we can offer:




Join a fast-growing global group with a turnover of ‚Ç¨565M and over 1,000 clients across the world

Be part of an international, multicultural environment of 7,750 talented people from over 60 countries and 5 continents, being able to benefit from international mobility opportunities and progress your career worldwide, and/or experience other departments and sectors.

Flexibility is the order of the day, so we have friendly remote policies, an intensive workday, as well as social benefits such as Transit, Restaurant or Kindergarten ticket, and Private Health Insurance

Explore opportunities to grow quickly with a tailor-made career path and salary evaluation: 70% of our key senior talent joined the company at entry level

Develop your skills with our Tech Academy catalogue in last technologies, access the Udemy E-learning Platform with over 500 training courses, which includes programs in interpersonal communication, team management, and project management, and participate in our Webinars and Workshops.

Choose your own training course with your annual personal budget and take advantage of our partners getting certifications paid for by the company.

Feel part of our Community by being part of our Languages sessions, Team buildings, Afterword hangouts, and the Event of the Year.

We have the We Care program, where the company aid critically affected employees.

Unlock your full potential, both professionally and personally.




Check for more opportunities on our website: https://careers.mantu.com/jobs




Equal Opportunity‚öñÔ∏è:




Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst (SAP BW)
Description:
Your new role:




Development of data models and transformations in SAP BW to fulfill reporting requirements
Development and monitoring of SAP BW loading jobs
Development of Reports with AfO and SAC based on SAP BW data models
Development of CDS Views in Source Systems (S/4 Retail) as Datasoure
Development of Views in GCP BigQuery as Datasource for SAP BW
SAC Administration Tasks
Development of SAC Dashboards




Requirements:




Experience with SAP BI platforms and very good technology knowledge in SAP BW on HANA, HANA Native, SAP BO, SAP BI-IP, SAP Analytics Cloud
Experience in an engineering / technology role, ideally in agile product environments / teams
Experience working in agile product teams, DevOps methods and continuous delivery with a focus on optimizing customer benefits
Very good written and spoken English skills, German is an advantage
Willingness to be on call on occasional weekends




What we offer:




Permanent contract directly with the end client
Young and dynamic environment
10% discount on the brand
Language classes
Training budget
Career plan
Intensive work schedule every Friday throughout the year and during the summer months
Competitive salary
Hybrid mode (1 day in-person/week)

  • Development and monitoring of SAP BW loading jobs
  • Development of Reports with AfO and SAC based on SAP BW data models
  • Development of CDS Views in Source Systems (S/4 Retail) as Datasoure
  • Development of Views in GCP BigQuery as Datasource for SAP BW
  • SAC Administration Tasks
  • Development of SAC Dashboards


Requirements:


  • Experience with SAP BI platforms and very good technology knowledge in SAP BW on HANA, HANA Native, SAP BO, SAP BI-IP, SAP Analytics Cloud
  • Experience in an engineering / technology role, ideally in agile product environments / teams
  • Experience working in agile product teams, DevOps methods and continuous delivery with a focus on optimizing customer benefits
  • Very good written and spoken English skills, German is an advantage
  • Willingness to be on call on occasional weekends


What we offer:


  • Permanent contract directly with the end client
  • Young and dynamic environment
  • 10% discount on the brand
  • Language classes
  • Training budget
  • Career plan
  • Intensive work schedule every Friday throughout the year and during the summer months
  • Competitive salary
  • Hybrid mode (1 day in-person/week)

Title: ESG Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
About The Organization

Sun Chemical, a member of the DIC Group, is a leading producer of packaging and graphic solutions, color and display technologies, functional products, electronic materials, and products for the automotive and healthcare industries. Together with DIC, Sun Chemical is continuously working to promote and develop sustainable solutions to exceed customer expectations and better the world around us. With combined annual sales of more than $8.5 billion and 22,000+ employees worldwide, the DIC Group companies support a diverse collection of global customers.

Sun Chemical Corporation is a subsidiary of Sun Chemical Group Co√∂peratief U.A., the Netherlands, and is headquartered in Parsippany, New Jersey, U.S.A. For more information, please visit our website at www.sunchemical.com or connect with us on LinkedIn or Twitter

THE ROLE

As an ESG Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring accurate reporting of Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) data. Your responsibilities will include:



Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting ESG data to meet regulatory requirements and support our sustainability goals
Ensuring compliance with regulatory developments and reporting requirements (e.g., CSRD, EU Taxonomy Regulation)
Evolve a reporting tool that integrates all aspects of ESG reporting
Collaborate with global cross-functional teams (HR, Procurement, Corporate EHS, Operations, and Business Teams) for effective communication of ESG data
Ensure key personnel across the company understand their responsibilities related to ESG reporting
Monitor industry and regulatory developments to stay informed about ESG standards



YOUR PROFILE



Relevant degree in sustainability, environmental sciences, biology, chemistry, or engineering
Working experience in sustainability-related functions, ideally with interpretation of data
Strong interest in Environmental, Social and Governance issues
Previous experience or coursework related materiality assessments is a plus
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint)
Willingness to work with databases is a must, knowledge of data collection tools is a plus
Excellent research, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Ability to develop own ideas and implement approaches alone and in a team
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills
Fluency in English is mandatory, any additional language is a plus



Benefits

We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k)+match and life insurance. Eligibility of benefit timing may vary.

If your experience looks a little different from what we‚Äôve identified and you think you can bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to learn more about you. Do you have any questions regarding the application process? Please feel free to get in touch with us. You can contact our recruiting team at: sun-careers@sunchemical.com

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

It is Sun‚Äôs policy that applicants for employment are recruited, selected, and hired on the basis of individual merit and ability with respect to the position being filled. Sun prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identify, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employment agencies are an important component of our talent acquisition strategy, and we value the partnerships we have built with our preferred vendors. We will not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies for any employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Sun Chemical or directly to hiring managers in any form without a signed contract on file, and search engagement for that position, will be deemed unsolicited in nature, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired as a result of the referral or through other means. Additionally, any resume submitted without a contract in place will be considered property of Sun Chemical and no fees will be paid to the agency if the candidate is hired.

Title: Analista de datos
Company: Germans Trias i Pujol Research Institute (IGTP)
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

IGTP Childhood Liver Oncology Group is looking highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team focused on childhood liver cancer research. You will play a crucial role in managing and analyzing data related to patients and biological samples. This data will be instrumental in advancing our understanding of the disease and developing new treatment strategies.




QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCIE:
Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Bioinformatics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Strong experience with data analysis tools and methodologies, including Power BI, RStudio and SAS.
Experience in creating data models and handling databases
Experience with data cleaning, validation, and management best practices.
Knowledge in advanced R and Python languages.
Proven ability to generate clear and informative data visualizations.
Languages: Spanish, English and Catalan (a plus).
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.




MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
Clean, validate, and manage large datasets using Power BI and potentially other relevant data analysis tools
Generate data visualizations and reports that effectively communicate research findings to scientists and stakeholders.
Collaborate with researchers to ensure data integrity and meet project timelines.
Maintain data security and compliance with relevant regulations.
May participate writing activities and contribute to research publications.




WHAT WE OFFER:
Full-time contract (law of science).
Date of incorporation: September 2024
Gross annual remuneration inherent to the square objected to this call, will be fixed based on the experience provided and the skills of the candidate, distributed in 12 payments.
Possibility of working from home two days per week.
Flexible payment (childminding vouchers).
23 days holiday and 5 days for personal matters.
Training capsules by the company.
Be part of an excellent multidisciplinary research centre with the HRS4R badge.
Location on the Can Ruti Campus, a first-class translational research environment in the Barcelona area, in a very stimulating scientific environment. The IGTP offers a supportive, friendly and collaborative ecosystem to promote professional development and help you achieve your research goals.




FOR MORE INFORMATION:

Check our website:¬†www.germanstrias.org/ca/research/cancer/2/oncologia-hepatica-infantil-c-log.

Other project websites:¬†www.pmed4hb.eu/

Ôªø

HOW TO APPLY:
Interested persons should send a cover letter explaining their interest in the position, their CV and contact details of 2-3 references by email to¬†seleccio@igtp.cat.
