Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
We offer comprehensive market support and actively develop various high-tech blockchain products. Having successfully collaborated with over 1,500 clients, Gotbit has honed its expertise in designing user-friendly and effective blockchain solutions for businesses and end-users alike.

Who We Are

Gotbit has been in the market since 2017 and has established itself as a Tier-1 International Crypto Company. We offer comprehensive market support and actively develop various high-tech blockchain products. Having successfully collaborated with over 1,500 clients, Gotbit has honed its expertise in designing user-friendly and effective blockchain solutions for businesses and end-users alike.

Our team of over 160 skilled professionals spans the globe, bringing diverse perspectives and expertise to our projects.

Currently, our OTC Trading Department is in search of a Quantitative Analyst, who will become the first member of the team.

Responsibilities


Conduct thorough research to identify and pre-select crypto-assets for the OTC trading portfolio
Investigate the cryptocurrency landscape extensively.
Analyze tokenomics, (utility value, distribution, staking, etc) of individual crypto tokens
Evaluate liquidity characteristics and assess the potential for growth.
Analyze the market dynamics and holding structures of tokens.


Requirements


Excellent knowledge of web3 and crypto
Strong knowledge of blockchain technologies
Data analysis skills
Strong logical skills
Basic understanding of programming concepts
Fluent English Level (C1)


Gotbit Offers


Remote work from any location
20 paid vacation days and 5 sick days annually
Full compensation for documented sick leave
Wellness support: We value our employees' well-being and cover expenses for sports, healthcare, coworking spaces, and team-building events
Continuous learning: Monthly Gotbit Educational Meetups featuring industry leaders help you stay ahead of the curve
Global exposure: Attend industry conferences with our sponsorship and connect with the world
Collaborative environment: Join our friendly and young team where all of your ideas will be heard


Apply now!

We look forward to receiving your application

Title: Business Analyst | Pharma Analytics
HTML:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of ‚Ç¨1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

We are currently looking for a Senior Business/Functional Analyst or Project Manager profile able to dialogue with Business stakeholder, gather requirements and provide detailed specification to Data Engineer.


Qualifications

- Mandatory experience on Pharma Analytics;

- Experience dealing with Salesforce data;

- Knowledge of data like Google Analytics and Social Media data; Salesforce marketing cloud;

- Understanding of brick level sales data from external provider like IQVIA;

- Previous experience of implementation pharma sales representative, brick level sales, market share reporting in a multi countries implementation.

- Power BI knowledge, from report building to workspace management and report sharing;

- Databricks experience from a end user perspective;

- SQL knowledge;

- Very good English is mandatory and excellent communication skills are required.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Principal Data Quality Assurance Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Principal Data Quality Assurance Analyst

Location: Lisbon

Introduction to role:

Join our Global Business Services team as a Principal Data Quality Assurance Analyst, where you'll be responsible for identifying, investigating, and resolving data issues affecting financial planning, reporting, and operations for assigned areas. This is your chance to contribute to global healthcare and sustainability challenges in a place built on innovation and creativity!

Accountabilities:

As a Principal Data Quality Assurance Analyst, you will act as a lead and subject matter expert for all data quality processes and activities related to your assigned area. You will own and manage DQA value and project involvement monthly internal and external reporting. You will lead the investigation of master data, transaction, and mapping issues affecting reporting and planning systems. You will define manual adjustments as needed to temporarily correct time-critical issues. You will work with process analysts to identify root causes of data quality issues and propose process and system improvements. You will use data quality reporting tools, system reconciliations, and direct data analysis to proactively identify potential data issues for resolution. You will contribute to improvements in tools, methods, processes, documentation, and controls within the team. Lastly, you will perform data quality profiling and produce ad hoc data quality reports.

Essential Skills/Experience:



Accounting background
Experience of working with financial data and systems, preferably using SAP
Background in data analysis and issue investigation in a complex data and system environment
Experience in the maintenance and use of common financial data (e.g., costs centres, profit centres, chart of accounts, transactional postings)
Experience supporting Finance month-end processes, reporting, and planning
Good understanding of data quality and data management principles
Proactive, analytical and investigative mindset
Proficient in Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Excellent attention to detail
Good written and verbal communication skills



Desirable Skills/Experience:



Experience of working in a complex global organisation
Pharmaceutical business awareness/business domain knowledge
Experience using data quality profiling and monitoring tools
Experience in querying data using SQL
Experience creating reports



When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we unleash bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That‚Äôs why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. But that doesn't mean we‚Äôre not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.

Why AstraZeneca?

AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company. We focus on discovering, developing, and commercialising prescription medicines for some of the world‚Äôs most serious diseases. But we are more than one of the world‚Äôs leading pharmaceutical companies. At AstraZeneca, we‚Äôre dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science, challenge convention and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. To embrace differences and take bold actions to drive the change needed to meet global healthcare and sustainability challenges.

Ready to make a difference? Apply now and join us in our mission to push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines!

Title: Data Engineer - Lisbon (Internal Team)
Description:
Description
Please note this role is a non-consulting position.

In this job you will develop and implement data pipelines on AWS, maintain and develop them further under guidance of business owners. You will work alongside Data Scientists, Data Engineers and others; integrated in our Product and Digital team. This role offers the chance to join Efficio at a pivotal point in our data journey, and to shape and influence our data landscape. We are looking for visionaries to build the future of procurement, join us!

This role gives you the opportunity to:


Collect business requirements and translate them into robust and scalable solutions
Demonstrate an understanding of DataOps and develop use case agnostic ETL pipelines
Take a proactive approach to work and become a go-to expert for data cloud migration
Work with state-of-the-art tooling on AWS including Redshift, S3 and ECS
Collaborate with our infrastructure engineers to provision the next generation of tools
Develop a sense of ownership to deliver high quality outcomes for the business
Make complex data more accessible, understandable, and usable by the organisation


Essential Requirements Required Skills:


An advanced degree in software engineering, computer science, a related technical field, or relevant work experience
Proven experience in building robust and reliable data pipelines, dealing with a wide variety of data sources
Strong experience in Python, knowledge of data wrangling methodologies and common packages
Proficiency with AWS Tools (e.g., S3, Athena, Glue, Lamba, Kinesis) as well as AWS CI/CD and readiness to learn/work with them
Experience with Docker, Airflow, and SQLs (ideally Postgres)
Fundamental understanding of programming landscape (e.g., APIs, SQL, database management)
Great communication skills, comfortable working collaboratively in cross-functional teams
Ability to manage own workload with a customer focus and solution orientated can-do attitude

Title: Credit Data Integrity Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Credit Risk Data Integrity Analyst sets-up, monitors, analyses and controls the data quality and integrity of Credit Risk data across Risk referential tools. This is achieved by building and maintaing data quality framework, designing, maintaining and running auditing reports and controls, investigating the integrity issues discovered and following-up on the remediation of such.
The analyst works with different stakeholders, business lines and functions across many locations and has to maintain a close interaction with Credit Risk Analysts and Credit Officers among others.


Your Main Activities Are


Execute data collection, data ingestion, data quality, data preparation and data cleaning
Implement credit risk authorizations granted to clients as per some credit committees decisions
Monitor and remediate the data quality of Risk referential tools
Support the deployment of the credit data quality framework and the design and follow up of data quality indicators
Define, drive and monitor action plans to address data quality issues raised by the group or reported by different domains
Perform data analysis, consolidation and reconciliation following the credit data quality framework
Collaborate through ad-hoc analyses to the evaluation and improvement of data quality topics related to the credit risk data main systems and referentials
Contribute to answering specific regulatory and managerial data requests
Contribute to the various Data quality committees


Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Economics / Finance / Accounting or related
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in MS Office Pack (Excel)
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to deliver / results driven
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Ability to develop and adapt a process


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is a leader in the Eurozone, and a prominent international banking institution with strong roots in Europe's banking history. It has a presence in 65 countries, with around 190 000 Employees ‚Äì including more than 145 000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


Since 1985, BNP Paribas was one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, the Group has around 7.100 employees across several entities operating directly in the territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines

Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services.

Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional client.


Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

HTML:
About The Job

  • The Credit Risk Data Integrity Analyst sets-up, monitors, analyses and controls the data quality and integrity of Credit Risk data across Risk referential tools. This is achieved by building and maintaing data quality framework, designing, maintaining and running auditing reports and controls, investigating the integrity issues discovered and following-up on the remediation of such.
  • The analyst works with different stakeholders, business lines and functions across many locations and has to maintain a close interaction with Credit Risk Analysts and Credit Officers among others.

Your Main Activities Are

  • Execute data collection, data ingestion, data quality, data preparation and data cleaning
  • Implement credit risk authorizations granted to clients as per some credit committees decisions
  • Monitor and remediate the data quality of Risk referential tools
  • Support the deployment of the credit data quality framework and the design and follow up of data quality indicators
  • Define, drive and monitor action plans to address data quality issues raised by the group or reported by different domains
  • Perform data analysis, consolidation and reconciliation following the credit data quality framework
  • Collaborate through ad-hoc analyses to the evaluation and improvement of data quality topics related to the credit risk data main systems and referentials
  • Contribute to answering specific regulatory and managerial data requests
  • Contribute to the various Data quality committees

Profile and Skills to Success

  • Bachelor Degree in Economics / Finance / Accounting or related
  • Advanced level of English, both written and oral
  • Knowledge in MS Office Pack (Excel)
  • Attention to detail / rigor
  • Ability to deliver / results driven
  • Ability to collaborate / teamwork
  • Ability to develop and adapt a process

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is a leader in the Eurozone, and a prominent international banking institution with strong roots in Europe's banking history. It has a presence in 65 countries, with around 190 000 Employees ‚Äì including more than 145 000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

Since 1985, BNP Paribas was one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, the Group has around 7.100 employees across several entities operating directly in the territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines

Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services.

Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional client.

  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

Title: SQL & Power BI Report Engineer (Lisbon)
Description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

YOUR ROLE

Responsibilities

Capgemini Enginering is seeking to reinforce our team with a full-time Reporting and Documentation Specialist. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in operationalizing and documenting processes related to reports and requests for external entities. The key responsibilities are:


Assist in the creation, maintenance, and management of documentation for processes related to external reports and requests.
Collaborate with internal and external interfaces to ensure efficient and cordial interactions.
Utilize data structuring formats such as XML, YAML, and JSON.
Handle SQL databases with a preference for SSIS experience.
Engage in ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.
Analyze and visualize data, with a preference for experience in Microsoft Power BI.
Work with Geographic Information Systems (GIS), particularly ESRI ArcGIS.


YOUR PROFILE


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Telecommunications, or a related field.
Proficiency in data structuring formats (XML, YAML, JSON).
Experience with SQL databases, SSIS is a plus.
Familiarity with GIS tools (ESRI ArcGIS is highly valued)
Knowledge of ETL processes
Experience with data visualization and analysis tools, particularly Microsoft Power BI.
Strong analytical skills.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Proficiency in English.


What You‚Äôll Love About Working Here


Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment.
Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance.
Engage in exciting national and international projects.
Hybrid work.
Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
Training and certifications programs.
Health and life insurance.
Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations.
Great office locations.


About Capgemini

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Apply now!

Title: Capital Portfolio Management Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Resource & Portfolio Management (RPM) Team is part of the Securitised Product Group (SPG), which combines all securitisation and other risk distribution activities within Global Banking EMEA ‚Äì Capital Markets
The Securitisation Trade Manager is responsible for the booking of transactions and the management of their cash flows (calculation, monitoring of payments, etc.) and for their correct regulatory Capital calculation in the systems, to achieve optimum Capital savings for the bank
Acting as a point of contact with investors during the life of the transaction, as well as for regulatory reporting, the Securitisation Trade Manager will develop expertise in transaction management (Securitisation, SRT, Credit Default Swap, Credit Insurance) and most importantly in regulatory Capital of the Bank
The Candidate will work with data to assess the Capital savings on the transactions under management and should have an interest in learning Python/SQL languages. The Candidate will also be key to ensure that all the contractual commitments related to Resources & Portfolio Management transactions are fulfilled


Your Main Activities Are


Advisory role in pre-trade phase by actively liaising with the Origination and Structuring team, to assess the feasibility of a transaction
Booking of transactions in Front-Office systems
Perform monitoring and payment of invoices to Third Parties (Investors, Brokers and Insurers)
Calculate the correct Capital savings by ensuring the right Risk-Weighted Assets (RWA) are calculated during the quarterly Capital process
Perform quarterly updates of the capital structure of existing programs and quarterly coupon computation and validation, following instructions of underlying flow of funds.
Identify claims based on rating triggers in underlying portfolios
Perform reporting to Validation Agent, Investors, Regulators, and internal stakeholders, acting as a point of contact for questions related to existing portfolios


Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral
Organisational skills


Why joining BNP Paribas?

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional client.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Architect/Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Rethinking IT.

We have lots of ideas about how to successfully drive digitalization in companies. For example, with open cloud platforms, highly developed security systems, and clever tools for developers. What is your role in this? Move the world from behind the scenes with your IT expertise and passion for game-changing information technology. Rethink IT and steer projects in completely new directions. Be bold when others would have given up. In short, play a key role in driving digitalization forward! We‚Äôll provide the resources you need to do this. We also offer a variety of opportunities to get involved and to be part of a global network of IT experts and professionals. Welcome to our world!

We Make Real What Matters. This Is Your Role.

Vision:

As data is supposed to be the new oil, making tangible value out of data will make the difference and is what we are striving for.

Supporting the business in decision making and answering increasingly complex questions in ever shorter time or even real time is our aspiration.

Mission:

By combining a profound knowledge of finance and related end-2-end processes with deep technical know-how and a fresh thinking with respect to problem solving, we provide state of the art IT solutions, services and platforms for finance departments with a focus on reporting, analytics and planning.

Key Areas of Responsibility:


Support in the relaunch of a solution for group consolidation with a focus on the provision of an integrated data layer that enables a pass-through from consolidated data to unconsolidated ERP data
Permanent self-reliant optimization of data models (in the context of S/4 Group Reporting, SAP BW/4, S/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud, Snowflake)
You envision, design and implement architectures and data models optimized for the integration of various, heterogenous data sources. You extend our service offering by business intelligence and reporting solutions to effectively deal with the new non-financial reporting requirements like the EU Taxonomy
Autonomously deliver/lead projects mainly in the context of an SAP BW/4 environment
Perform changes in alignment with BI colleagues and business stakeholders
Constantly provide innovations to improve or enhance analytics related solutions and service offering
Provide added value to data analytics initiatives / projects (migrations, predictive analytics, SAC, new projects)
Manage and coordinate external partners and communicate with various business stakeholders for the successful completion of projects and changes in existing solutions


Use Your Skills To Move The World Forward.


University degree in IT or Business Insights related field
Some years of experience in analytics and reporting (SAP BW, SAP BW/4, SAC, SAP ABAP, Snowflake, PowerBI)
Experience in an international group company and experience in SAP Group reporting are valued
Extensive experience in data warehousing, ETL processes and reporting (SAP AO, SAC)
Knowledge on HANA Studio (SQL/Java Script/CDS views), experience in cloud platforms, as well as any other BI tool are valued
Practical experience in collaborating with business stakeholders, experience within the area of Accounting / Controlling / Closing process is valued
Ability to learn and adapt to new environments / contexts / applications
Business Value and Customer focused, as well as goal-oriented professional with innovative thinking and attention to detail and a team player
Project Management experience in agile methodology
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and willingness to work in a multicultural team
Strong engineering/analytic skills and in leading BI projects and data expertise (modelling, analytics, prediction, simulation, AI/ML) and profound background in digitalization technologies is highly valued
Business fluent English


What we offer.


2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
Attractive remuneration package
Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
Find more benefits here


Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

www.siemens.com/careers - if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

FAQ - if you need further information on the application process.
Show more

  • Autonomously deliver/lead projects mainly in the context of an SAP BW/4 environment
  • Perform changes in alignment with BI colleagues and business stakeholders
  • Constantly provide innovations to improve or enhance analytics related solutions and service offering
  • Provide added value to data analytics initiatives / projects (migrations, predictive analytics, SAC, new projects)
  • Manage and coordinate external partners and communicate with various business stakeholders for the successful completion of projects and changes in existing solutions

Use Your Skills To Move The World Forward.

  • University degree in IT or Business Insights related field
  • Some years of experience in analytics and reporting (SAP BW, SAP BW/4, SAC, SAP ABAP, Snowflake, PowerBI)
  • Experience in an international group company and experience in SAP Group reporting are valued
  • Extensive experience in data warehousing, ETL processes and reporting (SAP AO, SAC)
  • Knowledge on HANA Studio (SQL/Java Script/CDS views), experience in cloud platforms, as well as any other BI tool are valued
  • Practical experience in collaborating with business stakeholders, experience within the area of Accounting / Controlling / Closing process is valued
  • Ability to learn and adapt to new environments / contexts / applications
  • Business Value and Customer focused, as well as goal-oriented professional with innovative thinking and attention to detail and a team player
  • Project Management experience in agile methodology
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and willingness to work in a multicultural team
  • Strong engineering/analytic skills and in leading BI projects and data expertise (modelling, analytics, prediction, simulation, AI/ML) and profound background in digitalization technologies is highly valued
  • Business fluent English

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

www.siemens.com/careers - if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

FAQ - if you need further information on the application process.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About The Job


BNPP Global Markets Americas is looking to expand its team of dedicated data engineers in Portugal to support Prime Services, part of the Global Equities Global Business Line (GBL).
The team in Portugal works closely with Prime Services Prime Trading Americas. This team is focused on generating business analytics, building data pipelines, and projects implementation to better position the business for their current and future needs. A primary focus of the role is assisting in the improvement of funding efficiencies and meeting client demand through improved data availability and analysis, client insights, and ultimately through enhanced data and business processes. The ability to work with large amount of messy data and designing and then implementing improved data models will be important. A successful candidate should have strong communication skills, be a team player, have the ability to learn quickly, and focus on delivery in a fast-paced environment. The job will require interaction with Front Office, Technology, and Product Development.


Your Main Activities Are


The required position would support Equity Financing business in its reporting : creation / automation / monitoring (both the indicators produced and the fact that report is being produced)
Within the Support team, the individual will work closely with Front Office and Quant Research :
Monitor production of daily reports required by the business :
Trouble shot with IT in case of production issue
Data quality check day over day. Escalation to Operations (MO) and Front in case of booking issue
Improve automation of reports production
Work with Business and Quant to enhance existing reports with new data / method
Automate production from XL based template to server based production
Design new reports, and provide analysis and optimization suggestion
Work with business to enhance our reporting framework to display more relevant indicators
Once familiar with data, help in the analysis of the reports , highlight outsiders and suggest improvements
Ability to travel to New York for a period of up to 1 month for on-desk experience and training

Profile and Skills to Success


BA, BS or MS degree in a quantitative discipline (Math, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Finance or Economics)
1-4 years of relevant experience such as in Data Analytics or Engineering
Experience in Capital Markets or Investment Banking
Perfect fluency in English
Good communication skills
Proficiency in Python, SQL Excel and VBA
Quantitative, analytical and logical problem solving skill
Basic knowledge of financial markets and Prime Brokerage
Experience using Dev-ops tools such as GIT, Jira and APIs


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Distributed Cloud | Data Analyst w/Looker
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of ‚Ç¨1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

Our Devoteam Distributed Cloud Unit is looking for a skilled Data Visualization / Analytics Engineer to join our team.

The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in Power BI, including DAX measures, UX/UI design, data storytelling, and performance optimization for large datasets. Experience with other Data Visualization tools like Looker or Qlik and proficiency in data modeling techniques, particularly dimensional modeling or Kimball methodology, are highly valued.

If this opportunity is for you, apply today!

We will rely on you to


Power BI Development:


Design and maintain advanced Power BI reports and dashboards.


Create complex DAX measures and optimize data models.


Implement UI/UX best practices for effective data presentation.


Utilize composite models and pre-aggregations for high data volumes.


Data Storytelling:


Translate data findings into compelling visual stories.


Communicate insights to stakeholders effectively.


Collaborate with business units to gather requirements.


Data Modeling:


Design and implement efficient data models using dimensional modeling or Kimball methodology.


Ensure scalability, maintainability, and performance of data models.


Integrate data sources and optimize ETL processes.


Knowledge of Looker is valued, as well as other visualization tools


Leverage Looker visualization and semantic model capabilities.


Stay updated on trends in data visualization.


Performance Optimization:


Monitor and improve BI solution performance.


Implement best practices for data management and query performance.


Handle large datasets efficiently.


Collaboration and Support:


Work with data engineers, scientists, and analysts on BI solutions.


Provide training and support to enhance data literacy.



Qualifications



Experience:


Proven experience as a Data Visualization/Analytics Engineer, at least 5 years;


Extensive experience with Power BI, including DAX, data modeling, and performance tuning;


Experience with Looker is valued;


Strong background in dimensional modeling or Kimball methodology preferred;


Technical Skills:


Proficiency in SQL;


Knowledge of ETL processes and tools;


Familiarity with cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud;


Experience with Python or R is a plus;


Understanding of data governance and quality principles is also a plus;


Soft Skills:


Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills;


Strong communication and interpersonal skills;


Ability to work collaboratively in a team;


Attention to detail and quality;


Preferred Certifications:


Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Fundamentals


Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate


Looker Certified Looker Business Analyst or equivalent

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating, and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary

Keyrus is looking for an Data Engineer. The ideal candidate embodies technical prowess in Cloud Data Engineering, coupled with a fervent commitment to making every piece of data matter. We value individuals who are detail-oriented, independent contributors with exceptional communication and problem-solving skills, ensuring that together, we continue to transform possibilities into reality.

This position is full remote.

Note: All applications/CV‚Äôs must be submitted in English.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather business requirements and translate them into technical solutions
Architect and implement data models, ensuring data integrity, quality, and consistency
Develop interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations to deliver insights to stakeholders
Optimize performance and reliability of data systems through monitoring, tuning, and troubleshooting
Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices in data engineering, analytics, and visualization
Mentor junior team members and contribute to the continuous improvement of data engineering practices within the organization


Requirements For The Role


Proven experience as a Data Engineer, with a focus on Microsoft Fabric and/or TimeXtender
Strong proficiency in SQL, T-SQL, and data modeling concepts
Hands-on experience with designing and building data pipelines, ETL processes, and data warehouses
Expertise in developing interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Power BI is a plus
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS, is a plus
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese or European citizen or have a work permit for Portugal


What We Offer At Keyrus Portugal


Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
Meal allowance of ‚Ç¨8.32 per day
Flexible benefits option
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration ‚Äì Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

At Keyrus Portugal, we're more than just a company - we're a constellation of bright minds and innovative souls.

If you're seeking a place where your passion meets purpose, where every project is a canvas and every challenge an opportunity, then look no further.

Join us, and be a part of a community that's shaping the digital frontier. At Keyrus Portugal, your journey to greatness begins.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather business requirements and translate them into technical solutions
  • Architect and implement data models, ensuring data integrity, quality, and consistency
  • Develop interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations to deliver insights to stakeholders
  • Optimize performance and reliability of data systems through monitoring, tuning, and troubleshooting
  • Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices in data engineering, analytics, and visualization
  • Mentor junior team members and contribute to the continuous improvement of data engineering practices within the organization

Requirements For The Role

  • Proven experience as a Data Engineer, with a focus on Microsoft Fabric and/or TimeXtender
  • Strong proficiency in SQL, T-SQL, and data modeling concepts
  • Hands-on experience with designing and building data pipelines, ETL processes, and data warehouses
  • Expertise in developing interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Power BI is a plus
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS, is a plus
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels
  • Fluent in English
  • Must be a Portuguese or European citizen or have a work permit for Portugal

What We Offer At Keyrus Portugal

  • Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
  • Meal allowance of ‚Ç¨8.32 per day
  • Flexible benefits option
  • Private Medical Insurance
  • 22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
  • Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform

Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration ‚Äì Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

At Keyrus Portugal, we're more than just a company - we're a constellation of bright minds and innovative souls.

If you're seeking a place where your passion meets purpose, where every project is a canvas and every challenge an opportunity, then look no further.

Join us, and be a part of a community that's shaping the digital frontier. At Keyrus Portugal, your journey to greatness begins.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Job Req Number: 72084

Time Type:

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Become part of The Centre of Insights and Analytics (CIA) team that is working with all DSV business divisions as well as Group Functions to simplify information gathering and turning data into insight
Create visually powerful dashboards in Microsoft Power BI that turn data into information
Champion user experience best practices for business stakeholders
Be a business partner for both business divisions/Group Functions as well as IT departments, acting as an interface to bring business intelligence to the next level
Support BI management in the implementation of the Global BI Roadmap
Design, develop, document and maintain business intelligence solutions
Support the advanced analytics team in creating advanced analytics solutions
Work in projects together with the business partners internally
Act as knowledge hub for Microsoft Power BI to empower business partners



Our requirements:



University degree in IT, business studies or any related studies
Minimum 2 years of experience in similar position (Business Intelligence)
Proven expert knowledge of Business Intelligence tools (focus on Microsoft Power BI)
Ability to visualize information in a value adding way
Experience with complex DAX functions and Power Query
Deep knowledge of BI processes and good practices characteristic for a large corporation
Practical SQL scripting knowledge (ideally SQL Server with optimization knowledge)
Azure Data Stack knowledge (Azure Data Factory, Azure Analysis Services, Databricks, Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2), with special focus on Databricks
Knowledge of advanced analytics / data science methodologies and tools (R, python, Pytorch)
Knowledge of data modelling concepts
Basic knowledge of SAP Business Warehouse
Basic knowledge of financial data structures
Fluent English both spoken and written



What we offer:



Permanent contract (with basic salary in 14 installments per year)
Private medical care
English courses - financial or co-financed by company
Food allowance (EUR 8.32, per working day)
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work (3 days in a week at the office)
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Good access to public transports



DSV ‚Äì Global Transport and Logistics

DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we‚Äôll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) is home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more. The ACCP offers rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe‚Äôs most attractive cities. The ACCP has been ranked as the #1 company in Best Workplaces (https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/) ranking in Portugal for companies between 201-500 employees, by the Great Place to Work Institute.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo ‚Äì Sete Rios, Av. Jos√© Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon

LIVE

What You Will Do

As a Data Engineer at Amgen, you will be responsible for managing and optimizing the company's data infrastructure and architecture for Clinical Data Hub. You will design and implement data pipelines, develop data models, perform data integration, and ensure data quality and governance. Your expertise in data engineering, big data technologies, and data manipulation will contribute to the effective storage, processing, and utilization of large-scale data sets. In partnership with enterprise data platform teams, functional technology teams and data scientists, the Sr Data Engineer ‚Äì Clinical Data Hub will be part of a team delivering key clinical trial data initiatives that are contributing to the advancement of a connected data vision, including the Enterprise Data Fabric (EDF). A connected data ecosystem is a key dependency to realize critical business strategies across Research and Development, such as AI/ML and precision medicine.

Key Responsibilities:


Collaboration and Planning: Work with Product Owner, Product Management, Agile Team, and Data Architects to plan and deliver prioritized Clinical Data Hub backlog items and optimize the technical environment.
Data Management: Ensure data requirements for applications, data scientists, and cross-functional use cases are met, and ensure high performance and reliability of the system.
Technical Implementation: Design, code, test, and review data pipelines to standards and best practices for clinical data solutions.
Lifecycle Support and Maintenance: Maintain, patch, and upgrade data pipeline solutions to maintain security and regulatory compliance, performance standards, and platform best practices.


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Basic Qualifications:

Master‚Äôs degree in computer science or closely related degree program

OR

Bachelor‚Äôs degree and 2 years of data engineering experience

OR

Associate‚Äôs degree and 6 years of data engineering experience

OR

High school diploma / GED and 8 years of data engineering experience

Preferred Qualifications:


2+ years of development experience with Databricks, including cluster setup, execution, and tuning
2+ years of experience building ETL or ELT pipelines; Hands-on experience with SQL
Experience with one or more programming languages, Python, R, SAS, Scala, or Java.
Experience with Software engineering best-practices, including but not limited to version control, infrastructure-as-code, CI/CD, and automated testing
Experience in clinical trial design and analysis
Experience in clinical Data Lake and Data Fabric space
Experience with data modeling, performance tuning, and experience on relational and graph databases.
Experience with AWS services: EC2, S3, EMR, RDS, Redshift/Spectrum, Lambda, Glue, Athena, API gateway, and design patterns (Containers, Serverless, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.)


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
What You‚Äôll Do

  • Accountable for bridging business requirements into analytics‚Äô models, such as BI and Big Data;
  • Produces both high and detailed level design documents which steers the implementation to outstanding standards;
  • Responsible to have an integrated and E2E view from source to report, including Campaign systems‚Äô impacts and outcomes;
  • Ensure and contribute to Team‚Äôs growth by sharing knowledge, leading to improve Team‚Äôs performance.


Who You Are

  • Degree in computer science or related field;
  • 7 years of work experience as a Data Engineer;
  • This role implies many interactions with different stakeholders. Therefore, excellent communication skills are required;
  • Should be a technology early adopter, have computing skills and expertise in different analytics/BI environments;
  • Team management experience is a nice to have;
  • Must have strong SQL skills;
  • Must have ‚Äúhands-on‚Äù Google Cloud Platform (GCP) experience;
  • Excellent knowledge of GCP components, such as BigQuery, Datafusion, Dataflow, Composer, Dataproc, Airflow;
  • Kafka and Talend knowledge would be valued;
  • Should possess knowledge on fundamental Unix/Linux


Not a perfect fit?

Worried that you don‚Äôt meet all the desired criteria exactly? At Vodafone we are passionate about Inclusion for All and creating a workplace where everyone can thrive, whatever their personal or professional background. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your experience doesn‚Äôt align exactly with every part of the job description, we encourage you to apply as you may be the right candidate for this role or another role, and our recruitment team can help you see how your skills fit in.

What's In It For You

We want you to feel happy and fulfilled at work, without compromising the other things in life that matter to you. There are lots of ways we support this, including hybrid working and generous parental leave. You'll also get four Spirit Days a year to focus on your personal development and wellbeing, plus a host of other great benefits too.

Who We Are

You may have already heard of Vodafone - We're a leading Telecommunications company in Europe and Africa. But what you might not know is that we are continuously investing in new technologies to improve the lives of millions of customers, businesses and people around the world, creating a better future for everyone.

As part of our global family, whether that's Vodafone, Vodacom or _VOIS, you'll feel a sense of pride and purpose as you contribute to our culture of innovation. We pursue equality of opportunity and inclusion for all candidates through our employment policies and practices. We recognise and celebrate the importance of diversity and inclusivity in our workspace and we do not tolerate any form of discrimination especially related to but not limited to race, colour, age, veteran status, gender identification, sexual orientation, pregnancy, ethnicity, disability, religion, political affiliation, trade union membership, nationality, indigenous status, medical condition, HIV status, social origin, cultural background, social, or marital status.

Together we can.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an agile & result-driven person looking for opportunities in a multicultural, secure & fast-paced work environment? AUTODOC is a multicultural tech-company active in 27 countries and with ~5000 people from over 50 nations where things are going fast-forward.

We are currently in a transformative phase and looking for innovative, tech-driven, and agile people to join us. We are striving to create an environment where people are safe and supported ‚Äî whether it‚Äôs in an office space or work-at-home.

Would this fit you, or do you know someone who would fit this description, then please contact us now and our team will get back to you as soon as possible.







Responsibilities:




Gathering and understanding business needs and objectives.
Develop strategies for effective data analysis and reporting.
Configure, implement and control the quality of analytics solutions.
Manage data analytics team and produce project deliverables.
Measure the performance of the project and provide optimization suggestions.
Partner with the Data Engineering team to define and build reliable data sources.
Work directly with senior management and recommend solutions and feature improvements.




Requirements:

5+ years of experience in data, product analytics, or business intelligence. Bachelor's degree in any related field.
Comprehensive knowledge of e-commerce area, funnels, customer journey, and pricing strategies.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Excel.
Proven experience designing and enhancing dashboards using BI tools.
Experience turning complex data results into meaningful visualizations with clear insights.
Deep understanding of principles of building a data warehouse and data modeling.
Good communication skills, and ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences.
Familiarity with A/B testing.
Fluent English.




Plus:

Experience in statistical analysis methods.
Understanding of the SDLC principles.
Developing BI solutions.




Additional Information:

Competitive salary based on your professional experience
Stable employment in the fast-growing international company
Wide benefit system
Dynamic work environment
Ability to influence business and its results
Professional growth ‚Äî you will attend free external and internal courses
Paid business trips and payment for participation in conferences
Paid corporate language classes (English, German, Polish)

Title: DATA ANALYST (HYBRID)
Description:
HYBRID LISBON ( 3 DAYS A WEEK)

ONLY RESUMES IN ENGLISH WILL BE ACCEPTED

For the Insurance area

About The Vacancy


The Data Analyst is a hands-on position with a focus on defining the data needs for the enterprise data warehouse. The position will work within IT to help Sompo International create an industry-leading data warehouse architecture. Furthermore, this data warehouse architecture will measure performance in all aspects of the organization‚Äôs operations.


Responsabilities


Work with business stakeholders and IT teams to analyze and resolve data issues for the enterprise data warehouse.
Create source (OLTP applications) to target (DWH) mapping documents to capture additional application data elements.
Load the source-to-target mapping documents from source systems into the enterprise data warehouse.
Collaborate with the ETL team to ensure the source-to-target mapping documents are in correct ETL code.
Ensure the ETL code align with STM requirements.
Perform data validation, to insure correct data movement into the enterprise data warehouse architecture.
Consult with reporting teams to develop a general understanding for the data warehouse model / optimal ways to use it.


Mandatory Requirements


B.S. Degree in Computer Information Science, Information Management, or Statistics.
Proven 3+ years‚Äô experience of data analysis ‚Äì extraction of OLTP data within an enterprise data warehouse.
Possess 3+ years of Policy & Claims Insurance subject-matter expertise.
Candidate has advanced level SQL knowledge.
Possess optimal knowledge for concepts and frameworks for Data Warehousing, ETL, and BI Architectures.
Candidate is capable of creating and tuning Semantic layer Reporting Views.
Able to facilitate data discovery sessions, which will include an audience of business subject-matter experts.
Proven knowledge of RDBMS platforms (e.g., SQL Server, DB2), with experience in generating DDL.
Possess knowledge of Guidewire Policy Center, Guidewire Claims Center, SAP FS-RI & SAP FS-CD applications with their data is considered a plus.


General Qualifications


Candidate has strong interpersonal skills, including both written and verbal communication skills.
Possess the ability to work as part of a team.
Candidate has strong organizational skills and analysis skills.


Location:

Boston, MA; Charlotte, NC; Colorado Springs, CO; Conshohocken, PA; Dallas, TX; Fargo, ND; Florham Park, NJ; Garden City, NY; Houston, TX; Jacksonville, IL; Lenexa, KS; Los Angeles, CA; Lubbock, TX; Mt Juliet, TN; New York, NY; Purchase, NY; Topeka, KS

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AUTODOC is a technology company with a leading e-commerce platform for vehicle parts and accessories in Europe. Founded in 2008 in Berlin, we are now 5,000 people from 68 nationalities, collaborating to make mobility easy and sustainable. By placing technology at the core of everything we do, we manage to serve customers in 27 European countries in 23 languages.

Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

What we‚Äôre looking for:

We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Data Analyst to join our new Pricing Data Team. As a part of the Pricing Domain, this team will be responsible for collecting pricing data, such as reference prices and competitive signals, to boost customer experience and power our decision-making.

Responsibilities


Building a corresponding dashboard and analysis to comprehend reference price coverage, driving the promotional processes across the entire company.
Constructing a dashboard and analysis in the competitor signals area to enhance our understanding of Autodoc's price positioning among competitors.
Working on improving the matching process, transitioning from manual matching of items to an automatic matching system.
Collaborating with other tech specialists, including developers, manual QA, and automatic QA, to develop a full-cycle solution.



Requirements


3+ years experience working in an analytics-focused role; e-commerce experience a plus.
BA in Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field;
Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience in Economics, Mathematics, or Computer Science preferred.



Hard Skills


Advanced SQL capabilities.
Python.
Power BI.
Experience working with algorithmic pricing systems and parsers Competera, PriceLab, etc. will be your advantage
Experience working with ML in terms of matching problems will be your advantage.
Advanced Excel user (Power Query, Power Pivot, Power View, DAX)
Ability to work with large amounts of data and draw conclusions useful for business on their basis
B2+ English



Soft Skills


Good understanding of the marketing and business processes of the e-commerce company
Ability to find points of growth / possible areas of optimization in the company's work and formulate action plans for implementing changes
Mindset on an independent search for facts. Ability to deal with uncertainty in data. Ability to ask questions correctly and formulate clear answers to them
Readiness for continuous development, expansion of the range of professional skills, and automation of routine operations.



What do we offer?


Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
Fast growing international company with stable employment
Annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday
Mental Wellbeing Program ‚Äì the opportunity for free psychological counseling for you and your family members 24/7 hotline and online sessions
Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
Free English and German language classes - Flexible working hours and hybrid work



Join us today and let‚Äôs create a success story together!

Title: Middle/Senior Data Analyst (FinTech Domain)
Description:
Company Description

We're seeking an accomplished Data Analyst with expertise in data visualization and statistical analysis, proficient in tools such as SQL, Python, and Tableau. The ideal candidate thrives in a collaborative team environment. This role goes beyond data crunching, encompassing responsibilities in data modeling, data interpretation, reporting, technical design, testing, documentation, and maintenance.

Our client has rapidly become one of Europe‚Äôs most fastest-growing fintech companies. They manage all aspects of financial operations, from generating virtual cards to facilitating wire transfers and maintaining customer account balances. As a payment institution, our client provides a platform integrating financial services into its product, including features like account management, card payments, bank transfers, and additional services.

CUSTOMER

Our customer is a leading FinTech company founded in 2016, offering a comprehensive spending solution designed for finance teams to facilitate faster and smarter spending decisions. Rapidly growing, they now serve over 4,000 customers and boast an international team of 500+ employees based in Paris, Berlin, London, Hamburg, and remote locations. They have raised over ‚Ç¨260M from prominent investors and have been recognized as a tech unicorn in France, with ambitious plans for continued expansion.

, Job Description


Collect, organize, and maintain accurate high-quality data from various sources
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights, and troubleshoot any data-related issues
Develop comprehensive reports and dashboards; communicate findings and insights effectively to stakeholders
Design and implement data analytics solutions for specific business domains, utilizing data science tools and techniques
Support process improvement initiatives by providing data-driven insights and collaborating with cross-functional teams
Work closely with clients and business stakeholders to understand their needs, ensure high-quality data reporting, and deliver impactful presentations


, Qualifications


3+ years of Data-related experience
Proven ability to ensure high-quality, accurate, and consistent data reporting
Strong knowledge of Python
Significant experience with Looker
Proficiency in visual analytics tools such as Power BI and Tableau
Strong experience in communicating effectively with clients and business stakeholders
Ability to deliver impactful presentations and convey key points from data analysis
Good understanding of machine learning instruments and algorithms
Broad experiencein exploratory data analysis and feature engineering
Experience in implementing and delivering data science and analytics solutions with measurable business impact
At least an Upper-Intermediate level of English
